Zenaida is a 36 year-old single mother.  She lives in her own house with her only child, Diner (age 11); she does her best so that he can have a good future.  Zenaida is a hard-working mother, and does everything to provide the best for her son.  

Zenaida has concentrated her efforts in business in order to get ahead in life.  She makes a living selling fruit, which she brings from farms to sell at the markets on Saturdays and Sundays in the city of San Francisco.  She has been working in this business for 10 years.  Selling fruit provides her with good profits.  Her plan for the future is to purchase more fruit so that she can continue selling to her customers, who know her for the good fruit that she offers.  

This is Zenaida’s first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she can count on the organization’s financing support.  She is grateful to the communal bank for giving her the opportunity to work with them.  She plans to use the 1,000 soles to purchase fruits such as pacay, pineapples, and oranges, among others.  This will allow her to continue selling fruit to her main customers.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as pacay, pineapples, and oranges.

loans.name: Janett Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña Janett continua administrando su Kiosko en el colegio, en  donde lleva varios años, vendiendo variedad de productos, ha crecido en venta,gracias a la clientela que ha captado en el colegio, siendo cliente fijos, asi como  mejorado su casa, con los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en varios ciclos de prestamo.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo seguira la construccion de pared, ya que abanzo bastante con el credito anterior, siendo su objetivo cerrarla toda de concreto, comprara materiales en bloque, hierro, arena, cemento, para seguir con la otra pared. Siendo su esposo albañil, ahorando la mano de obra. Que es de gran beneficios para la familia, al abanzar mas la construccion. estando doña Janett contenta al seguir con su meta.
texts.en: Janett continues administering her kiosk at a school, which she has been doing for a number of years, selling a variety of products. Her sales have grown thanks to the clientele she has attracted at the school, being fixed customers. She has been making improvements to her home with loans authorized by Kiva partner Afodenic for a number of cycles. With this new loan she wants to continue construction on a wall, which she made quite a bit of progress on with her previous loan, and her goal is close it off completely with concrete. She plans to purchase materials such as cinder blocks, iron, sand and cement to continue the work. Since her husband is a construction worker, they save on labor costs. Making progress with the construction is a great benefit to her family, so Janett is content in continuing toward her goal.

loans.use: to continue construction on a concrete wall, closing off her house and making it more comfortable and secure for her family.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años y es casada desde hace 25 años. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país trabajando. Maria tiene 3 hijas de 11, 16 y 21 años de edad, las cuales están estudiando.  La familia vive en Barrio Morazan en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. 

Maria elabora y vende tortillas de maíz desde hace 21 años y dedica 8 horas diarias al negocio. Inició el negocio con ahorros propios. Ha solicitado 3 prestamos con ODEF y el actual de L10,000 es para compra de fardos de harina de maíz para elaborar tortillas. 

Su meta es mantener una mejor calidad de vida de su familia y darle estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
María, 54, has been married for 25 years.  Her husband is working abroad.  María has three daughters who are 11, 16 and 21 years old and attending school.  The family lives in San Pedro Sula’s Morazán neighborhood.

María has been making corn tortillas to sell for 21 years; she spends 8 hours a day in this business.  She started it with her own savings.  She has requested three ODEF loans and the current one is for L10,000 that she will use to buy packages of corn flour to make tortillas.  Her goal is to keep a better standard of living for her family and provide schooling for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hammocks, vases, fabric and flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, drinks, sweets and canned food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, chicken, meat, medicines, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, detergent and other items.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana sigue creciendo en su negocio de venta de cosmetico, ropa, perfume, en donde ha captado la clientela por sus ventas de variedad, su esposo laborando en mecanica y muy responsable, su hija cursando el año escolar.
Juana desea invertir en esta temporada en paca de ropa, y ropa de cama, siendo de calidad y accesibles de precios, logrando aumentar de inventario, de productos nuevos para sus clientes, ya que tiene bastante cosmeticos, que espera sastifacer a sus clientes con esta nueva inversion. Asi como obtener mejores ingresos, para ayudar a pagar los gastos basicos del hogar, y equilibrarse economicamente, ya que todo esta ah altos costos.
texts.en:
Juana continues to grow her business selling cosmetics, clothing and perfume. She has gained a clientele by selling a variety of items. Her husband woks as a mechanic and is very responsible. Her daughter is enrolled in school.

This season, Juana wants to invest in packs of clothing and bedding that are high quality and reasonably priced. She will increase her inventory by adding new products for her customers, since she already has a lot of cosmetics. She hopes to satisfy her clients' needs with this new investment, as well as increase her income to help pay for basic household expenses, and find more economic balance, since prices are very high.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and bedding to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine because her only daughter is in bad health.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various kinds of fizzy drinks, noodles, rice, vegetable stews, sugar and canned food.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena, originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante. Comparte su experiencia vivida atravez del prestamo Kiva pues logro mejorar sus ingresos, lo invirto en compra de mercaderia tales como ropa de niños,adulto y ropa interior que necesitaba vender esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Ahora esta solicitando un segundo credito para comprar ropa para vender durante esta epoca navideña donde la afluencia de clientes es mayor y las ventas se incrementan y quiere aprovechar la temporada. Su objetivo es siempre seguir en su negocio y mantenerlo prospero y estable.
texts.en:
Azuenca, originally from Granada, is a merchant. She shares that her experience with her last Kiva loan allowed her to increase her earnings and invest in merchandise such as children's and adult clothing and underwear for sale. She is very appreciative for the support that loan has afforded her. 

She is now requesting a second loan to buy clothing to sell during this Christmas season when her customers have more to spend and sales are higher, so as to make the most of the season. Her objective is, as always, to continue her business, keeping it prosperous and stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 53 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, convive con Zoraida de 31 años. Juntos habitan en su  propia casa junto a su pequeña hija Gema de 06 años, a quien le brindan cuidado y mucha dedicación. La actividad que realiza Alejandro es la construcción de casas. Gracias a su buena labor como albañil, sus antiguos clientes le recomiendan con otras personas que podría él darle el servicio, de esa manera capta más clientela y por ende más ganancias. Tiene 18 años que viene trabajando en esta actividad y hasta el momento le ha ido bien. Lo más gusta es hacer un buen traajo y que sus clientes salgan satisfechos. Sin embargo, lo más difícil es no poder contar con suficientes herramientas de trabajo ya que algunas están demasiado deterioradas y otras que le faltan. Por ello con el apoyo financiero de MFP podrá comprar sus herramientas de construcción como: pico, pala, alicate, entre otros.  Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP y se siente contento por la colaboración que le brindan ya que así puede seguir trabajando. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar sus herramientas de trabajo como: pico, pala, alicate.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 53 years old and from the city of Quimbiri. He cohabits with Zoraida who is 31 years old. They live together in their own house with their small daughter Gema who is six years old. They provide her with a lot of care and dedication. 

Alejandro is in the business of constructing houses. Thanks to his good work as a mason, his long-time customers recommend him to other people in order to offer his services to them. In this way he has gained clientele and an increased income. He has worked in this business for 18 years and it has gone well up to now. The thing he likes the most is doing a good job and having customers that leave satisfied. However, the most difficult part is not having sufficient tools work his work. Many of his are in bad condition and others he doesn't have. This is why with the help of a loan from MFP he will be able to buy construction tools such as a pick, shovel, and pliers. 

This will be his first loan with MFP and he is happy with the support they provide him because he can keep working. With the 1,500 nuevos soles he will be able to buy his work tools such as a pick, shovel, and pliers.

loans.use: to buy a pick, shovel and pliers.

loans.name: Macedonio

texts.es: Macedonio tiene 24 años convive con Lizbeth de 18 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a su pequeña hija Nicol de 02 años a quien desean lo mejor para su futuro. La labor que realiza Macedonio es de trabajar con su moto llevando a sus pasajeros al destino que ellos indiquen. Para Macedonio trabajar con su moto es lo más agradable ya además que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Él junto a sus compañeros recorren por toda la ciudad en busca de más pasajeros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que las personas le llegaron a conocer y piden con mucha confianza que se les lleve. Tiene 02 años trabajando en esta actividad, y sabe que en tiempos de lluvia la gente recurre más a un moto taxista y es así que macedonio puede ganar más dinero. Por otra parte su mayor deseo es poder comprar muebles para su hogar como: cama, ropero y mesas; para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP y se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando muebles para su hogar como: cama, ropero y mesas.
texts.en: Macedonio is 24 years old and he lives with his life partner Lizbeth who is 18. They live in their own house with their young daughter Nicole, aged 2, and they want the best for her future. Macedonio offers passenger services bringing customers to their desired destinations with his motorbike. Working with his motorbike is what Macedonio likes the most, especially because thanks to this activity he can pay for his household expenses. Like his fellow drivers, he drives around his town looking for more customers. What he likes the most about his job is that the people who get to know him confide in him and ask him for his services. He has been engaged in this activity for 2 years, and he knows that when it rains people are more in need of a moto-taxi driver, so it is then when Macedonio makes more money. On the other hand his biggest desire is to be able to buy furniture for his house such as a bed, a wardrobe and tables in order to grant a better standard of living to his family. For this reason he hopes for your help in order to put his plans into practice. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues. The 1,000 PEN he is requesting will be used to buy furniture for his house such as a bed, a wardrobe and tables.

loans.use: To buy a bed, a wardrobe and tables for his house.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 36 años, esta casado con Itlich de 41 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a sus tres queridos hijos Luís de 10 años, Alexandra de 07 años y Cielo de 01 año; a quienes desean darles un mejor futuro. La labor que realiza Marisol es la docencia, pues trabaja en su centro educativo de su ciudad. Para Marisol atender a sus hijos y enseñar a sus alumnos es lo mejor que puede hacer. Desde muy temprano atiende a sus pequeños hijos para luego dirigirse a su centro de trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es enseñar a sus alumnos, tiene ya 18 años ejerciendo la carrera. Marisol cuenta que desde que llego a vivir a la ciudad, tuvo que comprar una casa para poder estar tranquila con su familia, pero lo que le afecta es no poder contar con un servicio higiénico. Es por ello que espera de la colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes de construir un baño y un lavadero en su hogar. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y se compromete en pagar puntual con sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, Podrá comprar materiales como: cemento, fierros, y asi podrá construir su lavadero y un servicio higiénico.
texts.en:
Marisol, age 36, is married to Itlich, age 41. They live in their own house together with their three beloved children, Luis, age 10, Alexandra, age 7, and Cielo, age 1, to whom they want to give a better future.

Marisol works as a teacher at an educational center in her city. For Marisol, caring for her children and teaching her students are the best things she can do. From early in the morning she takes care of her small children so that she can later go to the center for her job. What she likes most about her work is teaching her students who, at the age of 18, have already chosen their careers.

Marisol says that since she arrived in the city she has had to buy a house in order to have a peaceful life with her family. What concerns her is that she hasn’t been able to have a toilet. She awaits the loan so that she can carry out her plans to build a bathroom and laundry room in her house.

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She will be able to buy material such as cement and iron and, thus, be able to construct her laundry room and toilet.

loans.use: to purchase cement and iron.

loans.name: Brenda Magaly

texts.es:
Brenda, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, orgullosa y contenta nos cuenta que con el primer credito otorgado atravez de Kiva, ella logro surtir mas su tienda logro mejores ingresos para su negocio.A pesar de la dificultad que tiene por la inseguridad en su vivienda ya que la estructura es humilde ha salido adelante y podido superarse poco a poco pero ve la necesidad de invertir mas en su pulperia. 

Es por tal motivo que solicita un segundo credito para comprar granos basicos, pan , galletas, jugos y gaseosas ya que al vender mas productos y ofreciendo variedad lo ingresos mejorar y su negocio prospero. Pues su meta es ampliar su pulperia y mejorar su humilde vivienda casa.
texts.en:
Brenda is a proud and happy resident of the city of Granada. She tells us that with her first loan through Kiva she managed to better stock her store and achieve better revenues for her business. Despite the difficulty she has with the precariousness of her home, as it is a humble structure, she has gotten ahead and been able to advance little by little. However, she sees a need to invest more in her corner store. 

It's for that reason that she's requesting a second loan to buy basic grains, crackers, juices, and sodas, as selling a more products of greater variety 
increases her revenue and makes her business prosper. So then, her goal is to grow her corner store and improve her humble home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cookies, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 28 años convive con Julio de 38 años. Juntos habitan en su propia casa junto a sus 02 queridos hijos Julio de 08 años y Marcos de 04 años, a quienes promete brindarles una buena educación. Norma, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, chicha entre otros. La tienda de Norma es muy concurrida por los vecinos que la conocen; ya que prepara deliciosos refrescos. Lo que  más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 01 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más y así abastecerse de bebidas. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias y ampliar su puesto de ventas. Este será su préstamo número 03 con MFP y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando bebidas como: gaseosas, cervezas, fruta para los refrescos, entre otros.
texts.en: Norma, age 28, lives with Julio, age 38.  Together they live in their own home along with their 2 dear children; Julio, age 8 and Marcos, age 4, who they promise to give a good education. Norma is a very hard-working woman.  With her job she tries to excel ahead.  She is a woman that is dedicated to the sale of beverages such as carbonated drinks, beer, and liquor, among other things.  Norma's store is very frequented by the neighbors that know it; since she prepares delicious refreshments.  What she likes most about her work is to converse with her clients since this is one of her abilities that she employs to win a greater quantity of customers.  She has had this business for 1 year and considers that the most difficult aspect of the work is to remain standing almost the entire course of the day.  With the requested loan she will buy more stock in order to be supplied with beverages.  In time she hopes to increase her profits and to expand her sales position.  This will be her third loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments promptly.  With the 1,500 new soles, she will buy beverages such as: soda, beer, and fruit for the refreshments, among other things.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and fruit to make refreshments

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es: Rogelia de 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en propia vivienda junto a su pareja German de 32 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Rogelia, es el cultivo de café y cacao sobre tierras que llegó a comprar con su esfuerzo. Desde entonces se encarga de labrar y con la ayuda de su pareja y de jornaleros, logran sacar la maleza que crece entre sus plantas, asimismo le ayudan en la cosecha, como en el traslado de sus productos recolectados hasta las carreteras para luego ser llevados con movilidad contratada. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para desempeñar su trabajo, ya que dice que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con la plaga de insectos que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos. Con el crédito solicitado prioriza en comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP y esta contenta por la colaboración brindada para que pueda cumplir con sus planes trabajo; al igual que se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, comprará nuevas tierras para luego incrementar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rogelia, twenty-nine, is a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her partner, German, thirty-two, and their three beloved children to whom she hopes to bring a better quality of life.  Rogelia grows coffee and cacao on land that she was able to buy through her own effort.  Since then, she has worked with the help of her partner and day-laborers.  They were able to weed the plants, and they help with the harvest and transporting crops to the roadways to picked up by hired transporters.

What Rogelia likes most about her job is the freedom she has to direct her own work; she says what's best for her crops.  She's been in this business for ten years and finds the hardest part is fighting insect infestations that take over the sprouting plants.  

Rogelia plans to use her loan to buy new fields to expand her harvest.  This will be her second loan with MFP.  She's glad for the assistance she gets that lets her get the job done, and she promises to make all of her payments.  She'll use her loan of 2500 soles to buy the new fields so she can plant more crops.

loans.use: to buy land to plant.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura, de 29 años convive con Juan de 28 años. Juntos habitan en una casa alquilada que junto a su pequeña hija Xiomara de 06 años, a quien le brindan mucho amor y desean darle una mejor calidad de vida. Rosaura, es una mujer que se dedica al cuidado de su pequeña en el hogar donde habitan; con la ayuda de su pareja, quien se dedica a la construcción de casas para personas que piden de su ayuda por realizar buenos acabados de viviendas. A Juan le consta que tiene que esforzarse mucho para solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que Rosaura realiza la labor de madre atendiendo a su hija. A Juan y Rosaura les consta que tienen que apoyarse del uno al otro para salir adelante. Con el crédito solicitado piensan en comprar materiales de trabajo para que Juan continúe trabajando ya que tiene que solventar los gastos de su familia. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, esta contenta por la colaboración que se les brinda para que así puedan seguir con su trabajo. Ambos asisten a las reuniones que se presentan en su banco comunal y están contentos por trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrán comprar materiales de construcción como: pala, pico, carretilla, así podrá seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 29, lives with Juan, 28, in a rented house with their 6-year-old daughter, Xiomara, who they love very much and want to provide a better quality of life for.  Rosaura is a woman who is dedicated to caring for her little girl at home with help from her spouse who works building houses for people who ask him for help to achieve good finishing touches on their dwellings.  Juan is aware that he must exert quite an effort to cover household expenses since Rosaura does the job of a mother and cares for their daughter.  Juan and Rosaura both are aware that they must help each other to get ahead.

They plan to use the requested loan to buy work supplies so that Juan can continue working since he has to cover family expenses.  This will be MFP loan #1.  She is happy about the collaboration she’s getting because they will be able to continue working.  They both attend communal bank meetings and are happy to work with responsible people.  They will be able to buy tools like a shovel, a pick and a wheelbarrow with the 1500 new soles to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, a pick and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: William

texts.es: Wilian, un joven trabajador de 20 años, convive con Noemí de 16 años; ambos viven en la casa de sus padres, quienes le apoyan para que puedan sobresalir adelante. Wilian, es un joven con mucha voluntad que tiene para tener un buen bienestar. Él se dedica al transporte vial, en ir de la ciudad de Quimbiri a Pichari con su propio auto, que lleva a personas que mayormente recurren. lE se sietne muy feliz con su trabajo que realiza por el servicio que presta. Gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar con los gastos de su familia; los planes que tiene para su trabajo es adquirir nuevas llantas para su auto y así poder continuar con su trabajo. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP y esta contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para seguir continuando con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y no quedar mal ante su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar llantas nuevas para su auto.
texts.en:
William, 20, is a young man living with Noemi, 16.  They live together in his parents’ house who support them so that they can get ahead.  William is a young man who very much wants to have a good wellbeing.  He provides public transportation services to people who call on him with his own car between the cities of Quimbiri and Pichari.  He feels very happy with his work because of the service he provides.  Thanks to his work he’s able to help with family expenses.  The plan he has for his work is to buy new tires for his car so that he can stay in business.

This will be MFP loan #1.  He is happy to know that he will have financial support to continue with his work.  He commits to make his installment payments and not disappoint his communal bank.  With the 1500 new soles he will be able to buy new tires for his car.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es:
Berta de 57 años de edad, casada, originaria de Granada madre de un hijo, mayor de edad, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulpería. Inicio con una pequeña venta de hielo, helados, golosinas a medida que fue vendiendo y ganando clientes introdujo mas productos como avena, sopas, enlatados, papel de baño, productos de limpieza y cuando se dio cuenta  tenia una mini pulpería ya lleva 7 años de negocio y ha sido el primero. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de mercadería tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, snacks, productos de limpieza, cosméticos. Pues el financiamiento le ayudara a ofrecer variedad de productos que suplen las necesidades de sus clientes. Pues su objetivo primordial es que sea un negocio estable que le ayude a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha, a native of Granada, is married, 57 years old, and the mother of one grown son. She is a business woman and owner of a convenience store. 
She began with a modest trade in ice, ice cream, and candies. As she went on making sales and attracting more customers, she began to introduce more products like oats, soups, canned foods, toilet paper, and cleaning products until she realized she had the makings of a small convenience store. Now she's been in business, this being her first, for 7 years.

She needs this loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, snacks, cleaning products, and cosmetics. This financing will help her to offer a variety of products that will meet the needs of her customers. Her objective, then, is that hers be a stable business that helps her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, snacks, cleaning products, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Danelia una humilde comerciante de 47 años de edad, casada, se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Cuando ella inicio fue vendiendo dulces que ella misma elaboraba y también vendía toallas , después consiguió un lugar para vender en la acera del Mercado de Granada y justo ahí comenzó a vender mercadería entre ellos juguetes , artículos usados, sabanas. Es muy conocida pues la afluencia de clientes es muy seguida y su peculiar forma de atender a sus cliente y el cariño con que ofrece su mercadería la hace muy solicitada. Además ella tiene una mini pulpería  
En su casa de habitación ya que son parte de su segundo ingresos aunque la falta de productos que ofrecer no le ha permito crecer a su mini pulpería. Es por ello que realizo el crédito para compra de granos básico, sopas, pan , dulces, galletas, productos de limpieza, aceite, frijoles. Pues necesita ofrecer estos productos para poder ofrecer calidad y mejorar los ingresos de su negocio. Una de sus expectativas es establecer  un tramo con buenas condiciones ya que es donde esta actualmente es al aire libre y no cuenta con seguridad.
texts.en:
Danelia is a humble merchant, 47 years old and married, who sells general merchandise. When she began, she sold sweets that she made herself, as well as towels. Later, she secured a place to sell in the area near the Market of Grenada. That's where she began selling other merchandise, such as toys, used items, and sheets. She's very well known so her customers' support is continuous. Her unique way of waiting on her customers and the care with which she sells her merchandise leaves her very sought after. 

In addition, she has a small corner store in her house, which makes up part of her secondary income, though a lack of products to offer has kept her from growing her store. Therefore, she needs this loan to buy basic grains, soups, bread, sweets, crackers, cleaning products, oils, and beans so that she can 
offer quality merchandise and increase the revenues of her business. 

One of her ambitions is to establish a better quality site of her own, as she currently sells in the open air with no guarantee of safety.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, bread, sweets, crackers, cleaning products, oils, and beans.

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.ru:
Евгений женат. Его супругу зовут Людмила. У них два сына возрастом 9 лет и 1 год. Евгений имеет свой бизнес.
Он занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в теплицах. Этот бизнес очень выгодный для данного региона. Евгений имеет четыре большие теплицы и планирует поставить на новом участке пятую для рассады. Он трудолюбивый, спокойный и расчетливый. Он не собирается останавливаться на достигнутом, но планирует развивать свой бизнес дальше. Евгений просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на постройку теплицы для рассады.
texts.en:
Evgeniy is married. His wife's name is Ludmila. They have two sons aged nine and one years. Evgeniy has own business. He does cultivation of early vegetables in greenhouses. This business is very profitable for the region. Evgeniy has four large greenhouses and is planning to put a fifth one on a new site for the seedlings.

He is hard-working, calm and calculating. He is not going to stop at what he has achieved, but plans to develop the business further. Evgeniy is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvna to build a greenhouse for seedlings.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for seedlings.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.ru:
Вадим женат. Его супругу зовут Наталья. У них двое детей. Вадим имеет свой бизнес - он занимается фермерством. 

Вадим выращивает ранние овощи: помидоры, капусту, перец, баклажаны и т.д. Ему нравится это направление, и он хочет развиваться. Вадим трудолюбивый, предприимчивый и целеустремленный.  Этот бизнес - основной источник дохода для семьи Вадима.

Вадим просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен на закупку удобрения, семян, пленки. Кредит поможет ему увеличить прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Vadim is married. His wife's name is Natalia. They have two children. Vadim has own business - he is engaged in farming.

Vadim grows early vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, eggplant, etc. He likes this business and he wants to develop it. Vadim is industrious, enterprising and goal oriented. This business is the main source of income for Vadim's family.

Vadim is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy fertilizer, seeds and film. The loan will help him increase profits and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and film for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей  - один из лучших клиентов Надежды Украины в данной городе. Он постоянно пользуется микрокредитами. Ему очень удобно, так как кредиты - это быстрая возможность пополнить свои оборотные средства. В этот раз Андрею нужно закупить оптом большую партию пленки для продажи.

В бизнесе Андрея все в порядке. У него много постоянных клиентов, которые покупают у него пленку. Поэтому сейчас Андрей торгует у себя дома, на рынок не выезжает. Это экономит ему время, а значит и деньги.
texts.en:
Andrei is one of the best clients of Hope Ukraine in his town. He uses microloans all the time. This is very practical for him since loans allow him to replenish his working capital quickly. This time, Andrei needs to buy wholesale a big lot of [polyethylene] film.

Andrei’s business is going well. He has many loyal customers who buy [polyethylene] film from him. This is why Andrei is now able to sell out of his home, without traveling to the market. This allows him to save time, which   means saving money too.

loans.use: to purchase  wholesale a big lot of polyethylene film for resale

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalya is married. She sells women's clothing at Yulana market in Pavlograd town. Natalya started her own business 13 years ago. A small salary that was not paid on time forced her to think of having her own business. She began to sell women's clothing and her business began to grow. Recently she opened a second location. She is glad she can increase her turnover as well as give a job to someone who needs it. Natalya would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Buffallo Group

texts.en:
Harizon is the facilitator of the Buffallo group. Harizon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Harizon takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Harizon had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Harizon was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Harizon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. loans.name: Arzullah

texts.ru:
Arzullah jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Arzullah 45 let. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. 
On 14 let nazad nachal rabotat masterom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje rabotayet masterom i chinit doma. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya usovershenstvovaniya i razvitiya yego biznessa v dalneyshem i etim uvelichit kolichestvo mesachnix doxodov.
texts.en: Arzullah is married with two children. He lives in the Baku region with his lovely wife and kids. Arzullah is 45 years old. He's a very hardworking person. He began working as a master 14 years ago. He learned the business from his father, who also works as a master and fixes houses. He currently needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy the necessary tools to realize and grow his business, which will increase his monthly revenues.

loans.use: Purchase tools

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 1500 chickens and to own a delivery van to ease transportation. Florence lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

In 2008, Isatu established her provisions, school uniform, slippers, and foodstuff business. She began her business because she wanted to raise funds to pay her fees to further her education. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more provisions, uniform materials, and slippers for her business. In the future, Isatu plans to help her husband build a house for their family and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Namisa requires a loan in order to buy more provisions and drinks for her business. In the future, Namisa plans to develop her business to the point of a full-scale provision shop and to become a distributor for breweries and cold storage companies; she also plans to educate her children very well. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  lives in  Uganda. She is married and has 10 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives).        
Fatuma has a banana selling business. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works six days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested for a loan of 1200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.   
The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van to ease transportation problems. Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Gina provides a motorcycle or habal-habal service, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline her service.
Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for her motorcycle service

loans.name: Maria Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Maria Ligaya, she is 41 and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rosendo, a contractor, and is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Ligaya is a coconut dealer. She buys coconut from different farmers in nearby provinces and delivers it to her regular customers, the coconut retailers, who sell the coconut per piece or use it in their own business. She also manages a small variety store for added income. She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of the coconut needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maria Ligaya hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes that her children will finish their studies up to college. She also dreams of buying a vehicle to be used in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of the coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Yenoh. She is married and has four children aged 21, 18, 15 and 11 years old. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because they are her relatives. 
In 2008, Yenoh established her cookery business. She began her business because her husband’s income was not enough to support their family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. 
She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Yenoh requires a loan in order to purchase more food stocks for her business. In the future, Yenoh plans to acquire land and also educate her children to university level. 
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, stock and salt

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
This is Jessamin, 49, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Ruperta, a housewife and a mother to her two children, the youngest is still studying in elementary while the eldest is already married. By the grace of God, Jessamin has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to send his youngest to school. 

Jessamin operates a pineapple growing farm. He grows pineapple and some bananas on their farm located in Cavite, which is in the highlands where it is suitable to grow pineapple and bananas. He sells his product to markets and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 41, 000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Jessamin dreams of being able to give his family a good and future through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in his business.

loans.name: Muslim

texts.ru:
Muslim uje 10 let kak izgotavlivayet oblicovochniye takje stroitelniye kamni. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit instrumenti dlya razvitiya  svoyey raboti. On nujdayetsya v novom obarudivaniye s pomoshyu kotoroy on smojet za toje vremya izgotovit bolshe kamney. Etomu biznessu Muslim nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata kotoriy toje zanimayetsya etim biznessom.
Muslim 47 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Muslim jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi.
texts.en: Muslim has been manufacturing stones for facing and construction for 10 years.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tools to develop his business.  He needs new equipment that will allow him to manufacture larger quantities of stones in the same amount of time.  Muslim learned his trade from his older brother who is also working in the same field.  Muslim is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Muslim lives in the Absheron region with his wife and dear children.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Rashid.  He is married and has two children, aged 4 and 7 years, both of whom are in school. 

In 2001, Rashid established his artificial hair and jewelry business. He began his business because he wanted to develop a source of income to support his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Rashid has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy necklaces, bracelets and traditional jewelry. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. In the future, Rashid plans to establish his business in other cities, like Bo and Kono, build a house for his family, and educate his children well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, and traditional jewelry for his business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with five children.

Mary Jane has a shop that sells food seasonings, snacks, and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en: Richie, a 35-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has been making and selling snacks like banana cue and pancakes for the last five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, Richie is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tembea Uone Lugari Group

texts.en:
Yordan is a 46-year-old father of four children, two of them who attend secondary education. He has engaged in farming activities, especially growing coffee, maize and beans, for over twelve years. He has agricultural problems such as lack of fertilizer and insecticide that lead to low production.

Yordan seeks for more funds to finance his farming activities by buying fertilizer, insecticide and gum boots. He wishes to improve his scale of production in five years from 8 acres to 16 acres and to buy an insecticide pump machine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and gum boots

loans.name: Florie

texts.en: Florie, a 49-year-old married mother of  five, lives in the Philippines where she has been making and selling snacks like pan and rice cakes for the last five years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more raw ingredients to make snacks. In the future, Florie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister. Maureen has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. 

Maureen sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Maureen has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of oranges, tomatoes, cabbages and mangoes.      

The main business challenges for Alice include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to own more than one stall selling fruits. 

Maureen lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of oranges, tomatoes, cabbages and mangoes.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Maria Theresa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maria Theresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Mariatu. She is married and has four children, ages 16, 13, 10 and 7. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan. 

In 2004, Mariatu established a business selling traveling bags, ladies' bags and laptops. She began her business because she wanted to enhance her independence and help her husband to provide for their children. 

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Mariatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy traveling bags and ladies' bags for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to convert her store into a mighty store and to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy traveling bags and ladies' bags for her business.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Cecile has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cecile has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cecile hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
Urbano is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has seven children. 

Urbano has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Urbano has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Urbano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, a 44-year-old married mother of seven, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra for the last 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Ulduza

texts.ru:
Eto vtoraya ssuda Ulduza, ves yeyo kredit bil pogashen vovremya bez zaderjok. Ona shitayetsya nashim xoroshim chlenom. Ulduza ochen blagodarna Kive i Lenderam za predostavlennuyu ssudu. Eto ssuda yey ochen pomogla v uludshenii biznessa. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. 
Ulduza uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. 
Ona zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ulduza yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Absheron regione posolok Masazir vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Ulduza 46 let. 


http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/170701
texts.en: This is Ulduza's second loan, her former loan was repaid on time without any delay.  She is considered a member of good standing.  Ulduza is extremely thankful to Kiva and its lenders for granting her a loan.  Her first loan really helped her improve her business.  Currently she needs 2,000 AZN which will be used to buy sheep and increase the quantity of livestock for sale.  Ulduza has been working in animal husbandry and raising sheep for 9 years already.  She is married and has  four children. Ulduza is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli.  She now lives in the settlement of Masazir in the Absheron region with her husband and children.  Ulduza is 46 years old.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Roy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Roy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has five children ages 20, 18, 15, 9, and 5. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is a relative of her husband. In 2006, Kadiatu established her local foodstuff business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in providing support to the family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 leones. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy garri, bulgar, beans, and groundnuts for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 leones. In the future, Kadiatu plans to rent a big store, build a house, and give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri, bulgar, beans, and groundnuts for her business

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Sisi Kwa Sisi Myangayanga Group

texts.en:
Kevin is a 40-year-old married man with five children, two of whom are attending secondary school. He has worked in farming for over two years, producing coffee, maize, and beans. He has agricultural problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Kevin tries his best to find funds for purchasing fertilizers and insecticides. In five years he dreams to boost his scale of production from five to eight acres and to improve his standard of living by building a good house and having his own private transport.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Emma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas. Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. Celso has a shop that makes and sells homemade sausage, or longganisa. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage. Celso has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Celso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto, a 40-year-old widower, lives in the Philippines where he has operated a shop that sells green bananas and coconut for copra for the last 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Alberto is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson, who is 57 years old, separated, and has one child, lives in the Philippines where he has operated a shop that sells fish such as sardines and trout for the past 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Samson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jardin

texts.en:
Jardin is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jardin has a shop that sells prepaid cellphone credits for a number of networks including GLOBE and SMART. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 so she can buy additional prepaid credits to sell. 

Jardin became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jardin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid cellphone credits to sell.

loans.name: Retchie

texts.en:
Retchie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Retchie has a shop that sells electronic loads from several networks like Globe and Smart. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional stocks of electronic loads.

Retchie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Retchie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of electronic loads.

loans.name: Vergincita

texts.en:
Vergincita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Vergincita makes and sells snacks like banana-cue (fried, caramelized bananas) and pancakes. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Vergincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vergincita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Nancy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and electronic loads for cell phones. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and electronic loads to sell.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and electronic loads for sale.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Evelia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Leodaliza

texts.en:
Leodaliza is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Leodaliza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She also has a flower garden and she harvests and sells flowers during harvest time. 

She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 24,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leodaliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Leodaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Delia has a shop that makes and sells viands and snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Matilda. She is married and has two children age 7 and 18 years. 

In 2001, Matilda established her cooking condiments business. The business started in a small stall at home, and now has a stall at the central market. 

Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Matilda has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to buy more cooking condiments for her stall. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Matilda plans to move to a shop, begin to sell wholesale and improve the life of her family.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more cooking condiments for her business.

loans.name: Muniru

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Muniru. He is married, and has two children, age 3 and 8 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help his wife with the house chores.  

In 2007, Muniru established his provision and drinks business. He began his business out of the need to be able to get a reliable source of income and become sustainable. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Muniru has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now he requires a new loan in order to buy milk, sardines, margarine, mayonnaise and drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Muniru plans to move to the town center and open a business for his wife and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy milk, sardines, margarine, mayonnaise and drinks for his business.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Isata. She is married and has four children, age 5, 10, 20, and 25. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help a sister with her child's education and to help with the house chores.  

In 1991, Isata established her cooking condiments business. She started the business by selling at home. The business is special because it helps in aiding her husband to run the home. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,284,400 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to increase her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 256,880 SLL. 

In the future, Isata plans to expand to another store with the help of her sister  and to be able to meet the needs of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Augusta. She is married, and has four children, age 7, 10, 18 and 25. 

In 2004, Augusta established her patient drugs business. She began her business to help the sick in the area after graduating from a school of nursing. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 7,385,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Augusta has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to stock more drugs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 1,477,000 SLL. 

In the future, Augusta plans to move from a patient drug store to a pharmacy, to be able to employ other person and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase her stock of medical drugs.

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en: This is 47 year old Amidu.  He is married, and has five children aged 3, 8, 12, 14 and 21 years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives, whose parents are living in the village. Amidu looks after them while they attend school in the city.  In 1986, Amidu established his men's shoes, shirts, boots, caps, jeans, T -shirts and shorts business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Amidu has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy shirts, jeans and shoes for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Amidu plans to expand his business to other areas in the township, allowing the family to rise to a higher economic level in the community. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy shirts, jeans and shoes for his business.

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en: This is 41 year old Ansu.  He is single, and has two children, seven and four years old. In 2001, Ansu established his men's footwear (shoes and sneakers) business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and get a reliable source of income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Ansu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now needs a new loan in order to buy more shoes and sneaker for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Ansu plans to move to a shop rather than a stall, build a dwelling house for his family and educate his children well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sneakers for his business.

loans.name: Sameeha

texts.en:
Sameeha is a 44-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Sameeha sells dairy products which she makes at her home and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase goats for milk and other dairy products.

Sameeha is looking to open a shop for her products instead of working from home.

Due to cultural issues, Sameeha's brother agreed to be photographed instead of Sameeha.

loans.use: to purchase goats for milk and other dairy products.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: This is 41 year old Hassan.  He is married, and has five children aged 2, 6, 9, 14 and 24 years. He has four additional dependents who live with him. They are his younger brother and sisters, and he assists with their schooling.  In 1995, Hassan established his provision and mobile phone card top-up business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and get a source of income to provide livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hassan has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now needs a new loan in order to buy sugar, milk, margarine, mayonnaise, ovaltine and mobile phone recharge cards for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Hassan plans to develop his business to the point becoming a wholesale trader, build a house and educate his children to the highest possible level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions such as sugar, milk, margarine, mayonnaise, ovaltine and mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is a 61-year-old widow from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and she has one child.

Etaf makes handicrafts from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase raw materials needed for her business (glass, wood, etc.)

Through the life cycle of her business, Etaf was able to develop it by purchasing new equipment for cutting wood and painting it.

Etaf is looking to improve her home-based business through opening a carpentry shop and she is also looking to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for her business ( glass, wood, etc.)

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 42, married and has four children aged 19, 16, 12 and 9. In 1999, she established her local food-stuff business, which she started in order to assist her husband in running the home. It is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. Doris has already received, and successfully repaid, her first loans and now requires a new loan of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy garri,bulgur, beans and palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Doris plans to own her own store, to own a house, and to give her children quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri, bulgur, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 60-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Fatima does embroidery from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase materials needed for her project (cloth, thread, needles, etc.)

Fatima is looking to expand her business through selling her products in the shops in nearby areas.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her project ( cloth, thread, needles, etc.)

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman; Jordan and she has five children.

Zeinab sells clothing and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more clothing to sell.

Zeinab started her home-based business by selling clothes to neighbors and relatives then she expanded her scope and targeted new people.

Zeinab is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hoson

texts.en:
Hoson is a 50-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Hoson sells blankets and clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to increase her income by purchasing more clothes and blankets to sell.

Hoson is looking to open a shop for her products instead of selling them from home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Ashweya

texts.en:
Ashweya is a 57-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Ashweya has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more goods for the store.

Ashweya is looking to improve her family's living conditions .

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 40-year-old woman from Mdaba, Amman; Jordan and a mother of four children.

Khawla sells goods and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase cloths, perfumes and makeups for trading purpses 

Khawla is looking to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her income and improve her family life conditions.

Due to cultural issues, Khawla's sister-in-law agreed to be photographed in her place.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, perfumes and makeups for trading purpses

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 42-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and has six children.

Khadra has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more goods for her store.

Khadra is looking to improve her family life conditions.

Due to cultural issues, Khadra's son was photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the store.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 30-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Raghda sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to to purchase clothes to sell.

Raghda is looking to open a shop for her business and improve her family life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 47-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan and she is a mother of four children.

Fareeda is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase clothes to sell.

Fareeda is looking to open a shop for her business instead of working from home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Shams

texts.en:
Shams is a 20-year-old single woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Shams has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to redecorate her store and purchase more goods to sell.

Shams is looking to expand her store and increase her family's income.

Due to cultural issues, Shams's father was photographed in her place.

loans.use: to redecorate the store and purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara is a 26-year-old woman and a mother of two children.

Lara sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more clothes to sell.

Lara is looking to opening a shop to sell clothes from and improving her family life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Badeea

texts.en:
Badeea is a 57-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Badeea sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase clothes to sell.

Badeea is looking to customize a separate  room at her home so that she can sell her clothes from it.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes Bernardina

texts.es: La señora Lourdes, se dedica a la venta de jugos y frescos ensaladas  de frutas, el puesto esta ubicado en una plaza de la zona de Tembladerani,   la señora es separada de su esposo,  era cliente antigua de la institución siendo socia de un banco de emprendimiento,  cliente cumplida no tubo problemas con el pago de sus cuotas, decido sacar un crédito individual para la compra de azúcar y leche en polvo al por mayor para el preparado de sus jugos, ya que por esta época d calor tiene gran demanda de sus riquísimos jugos, tiene cincuenta un años y con muchas gana s de seguir adelante, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingreso para mantenerse y se siente agradecida con la institución por su gran apoyo.
texts.en: Lourdes sells juice, soft-drinks and fruit salad; her stand is located in a square in Tembladerani.   She is separated from her husband.  She used to be a longstanding client of the institution being a member of a communal bank.  She made her payments and had no problems with them.  She decided to take out an individual loan to buy sugar and powdered milk at wholesale for her juice preparation because during the hot season she has quite a bit of demand for her delicious juices.  She is 50 years old and very much wants to get ahead because this is her only source of income to support herself and she is grateful to the institution for its great support.

loans.use: to buy sugar and powdered milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Emeteria Emeride

texts.es: La señora Emetria vive en casa propia, cuenta con un puesto propio en una de las calles concurridas y comerciales de la ciudada de Cochabamba en este lugar donde la venta es alta por la ubicación  del  puesto de venta, vende exclusivamente ropa de mujer y segun a la temporada, el dinero lo necesita para traer ropa de temporada ya que por esta época y cerca a las fiestas de fin de año es donde bastante demanda tiene de ropa femenina, le va muy bien con esta actividad se siente feliz porque se le brinda esta oportunidad para crecer en su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora joven con ganas de superación esta es su unica actividad con la que se mantiene.
texts.en: Emetria lives in her own house.  She owns a stand on one of the city of Cochabamba’s largest, busiest streets.  Sales are high because of the stand’s location.  She sells women’s clothes exclusively.  She needs the money to have seasonal clothes because during this season and close to the end of year festivities demand for women’s clothes is very high.  She does well with this activity and feels happy because she’s getting this opportunity to grow in business.  She is a very hardworking young person who very much wants to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Mamani Aycaya

texts.es: La Sra. Máxima  tiene como actividad  la venta de ropa interior y medias de forma ambulante en el mercado la Pampa de la ciudad de Cochabamba; la mercadería la adquiere en Oruro posteriormente los comercializa en Cochabamba, tiene experiencia de 1 año en esta actividad; su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus 3  hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar ; su esposo el Sr. Juan es empleado publico quien trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz; la casa donde vive es en alquiler la cual esta ubicada al sud de la ciudad,  una zona periurbana;  el crédito que se le otorga es para la compra de mercadería ropa interior y variedad de medias con esta actividad logra sustentar a sustentar a su familia.
texts.en: Máxima's business is selling underwear and socks as an itinerant vendor in La Pampa market, in the city of Cochabamba.  She acquires her merchandise in Oruro and then sells it in Cochabamba.  She has one year's experience in this business.  Her family consists of her husband and her three school-age children.  Her husband, Juan, is a civil servant and works in the city of La Paz.  They rent their house and it is located in the south of the city, in a peri-urban area.  Máxima will use her loan to buy merchandise (underwear and a variety of socks).  Through this business, she manages to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma continua vendiendo comida, en su pequeño comedor, contando con el apoyo de su esposo, que labora en profesion de abogado, sus dos hijos estudiando para un futuro mejor.
Con este nuevo prestamo, invertira en la compra de productos, para la preparacion de sus platillos variados, como carne, pollo, productos lacteos, granos basicos, frutas y verduras, lo que le permitira mantener en equilibrio sus ventas.
Y poder obtener mejores ganancias, para apoyar  a su suegra, con los medicamento, ya que son caros y esta muy enferma de salud, esperando no le falten para su recuperacion.
texts.en: Doña Vilma goes on selling food in her little dining hall with the help of her husband, who works as a lawyer, and her two children who are studying for a better future. With this new loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients need to make her various dishes, such as meat, chicken, dairy products, basic grains, fruits, and vegetables, which will allow her to keep up her her current sales. She needs to be able to make higher revenues in order to support her mother-in-law, who is quite ill, with her medicine, which is very expensive. She hopes to not have to go without the medecine for the sake of her recovery.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients needed to make her delicious dishes, such as meat, chicken, dairy products, basic grains, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
En el mercado de la ciudad de Granada donde la afluencia de compradores y vendedores es constante encontramos a doña Silvia, de 45 años, comerciante vende cosméticos y artículos de bisutería, casada, tiene 3 hijos. Inicio su negocio a los 25 años de edad con tan solo un canasto pequeño en el cual exhibía bisuterías antes no tenía un lugar fijo de vender pero al pasar el tiempo e ir ganando clientes fue que logro  obtener un pequeño tramo  donde vende cosméticos de uso popular esta ha sido su primer negocio. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra cosméticos tales como lápiz labial, estuche de sombra, delineadores, cremas, colonias, shampoo, jabones perfumados. Pues se acerca la temporada donde el número de compradores es mas frecuente y necesita mercadería para ofrecer. Poe lo pronto uno de sus  objetivos más cercanos es mejorar la estructura de su tramo para guardar su mercadería y no pagar alquiler de bodega.
texts.en:
In the Granada city market, where there is constant interaction between buyers and sellers, we find Doña Silvia. She's a 45-year-old merchant selling cosmetics and costume jewelry, and is married with 3 children. She started her business when she was 25-years-old with just a single little basket from which she sold costume jewelry.
