At that time, she didn't have a fixed location, but in time she went on gaining customers and managed to secure a small site where she sells popular cosmetics. This has been her first business. 

She's requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as lipliner, eye shadow, eyeliner, creams, cologne, shampoo, and scented soaps.As the season is coming up where the number of buyers is greatest, she needs more merchandise to offer. One of her most immediate objectives is to improve the structure she sells out of so she can keep her merchandise safe and not have to pay to rent storage space.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lipliner, eye shadow, eyeliner, creams, cologne, shampoo, and scented soaps.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Doña Rafaela tiene la edad de 59 años, de oficio cocinera, casada y madre de  seis hijos todos casados, su esposo labora de albañil, y ambos han venido esforzandose para vivir dignamente en su hogar.
Con su credito anterior logro la mejora de su techo, al poner perlines, y hoy continuara con la mejora del baño al hacerlo de concreto, y lograr mejor higiene, privacidad, mejor aseo personal, el cual esta contenta por realizar la obra, y que gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic otorga,se esta haciendo posible un mejor techo.
texts.en: Doña Rafaela, 59-years-old and married with six children, all of whom are married, is a cook. Her husband is a brick-layer and they have both been pushing themselves to live a life of dignity in their home. With her prior loan, she managed to improve her roof, putting up beams. Now, she will be continuing with the improvement of the bathroom, redoing it in concrete in order to gain better hygiene, privacy, and personal cleanliness. She's happy to go on with the work and thanks to the financing provided through Afodenic [Kiva field partner] her improved roof was made possible.

loans.use: to renovate her bathroom for better hygiene and privacy for her family.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón, tiene la edad  de58 años, está en casado y vive solo actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal como lo son el abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra. El cuenta con un cafetal ya establecido desde varios años atrás y actualmente necesita una buena asistencia para poder producir más cosecha este año. El tiene como meta darle a su cafetal la mejor asistencia para cosechar y más calidad de café producido. Unas de sus mayores metas es generar más ganancias que las cosechas anteriores y salir adelante con el crédito y mejorar su estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ramón is 58 years old, married, and currently lives alone.  He will use his loan to buy supplies which he needs for his coffee plants such as fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.  He will also pay laborers.  He has a coffee plantation which has been established for several years and he needs to provide good care for his plants so that he can produce a bigger harvest this year.  His goal is to provide better care for his crops so that he can produce better-quality coffee.  Some of his biggest goals are to make more profits than he did with his previous harvests, to use his loan well and to improve his financial stability.  This is the first loan that Ramón has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Comerciante, de 36 años de edad, originaria de Granada es Maritza , madre soltera, su hija tiene 10 años de edad, esta por finalizar su sexto grado de primaria además de ser su apoyo y compañía mientras ella atiende la pulpería y la pequeña  hace sus tareas de clase. Inicio su negocio por circunstancias de la vida pues se separo del padre de su hija. El apoyo de el ha sido casi nulo y ella no podía permitir que le hiciera falta nada a su hija fue entonces que  decidió poner su negocio en su casa de habitación donde puede generar ingresos y atender a su hija. Lleva 3 años con este negocio. 
Ella solicito el préstamo para surtir su venta de granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, productos de limpieza. Una de sus expectativas a futuro es brindarle una buena educación a su hija y lograr agrandar su pulpería  donde ofrezca de todo tipo de productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
A merchant, Maritza is a 36-year-old single mother of a 10-year-old daughter, who is finishing up the sixth grade while also serving as her support and company. While she looks after the convenience store, her daughter does her homework. She started her business because of life circumstances when she separated from the father of her child. Though his support was minimal, she couldn't allow for her daughter to go wanting for anything and so she resolved to start her business in her home where she could earn an income and look after her daughter. She's had this business for 3 years. 

She is requesting this loan to stock up for sales of grains, sugar, oils, dairy products, and cleaning products. One of her ambitions for the future is to provide a good education for her daughter and manage to expand her convenience store where she offers all types of products for the home.

loans.use: to stock up for sales of grains, sugar, oils, dairy products, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está en casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende sembrar un almacigo de café que posee y comprarle los abonos necesarios para el crecimiento. El cuenta con una propiedad acta para la plantación de este cultivo y quiere sembrar todo el terreno de café para aumentar el terreno en producción. El tiene la experiencia necesaria para llevar acaba el proyecto por lo cual invertirá. El tiene como meta poder tener ese cultivo nuevo de café produciendo para así generar más cosecha para el próximo año y cada vez así ir generando una mejor estabilidad económica y bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old, married, and lives with his three children and his wife, who are his main priority.  He plans to use this loan to sow a bed of coffee that he owns and to buy the fertilizers he needs for his plants to grow.  He has suitable land for planting this crop and would like to sow all his land with coffee in order to increase the amount of land he has under production.  He has the experience he needs to carry out the project in which he will invest.  Carlos' goal is to be able to sow this new coffee crop so that he can achieve a bigger harvest next year and thereby continue improving his financial stability and his family's well-being.  

This is the first loan that Carlos has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his new coffee plantings

loans.name: Celia  Magdalena

texts.es: Celia de 36 años de edad, es comerciante, tiene dos hijos, habita en la ciudad de Granada. Ella trabaja junto con su padre vendiendo ropa interior, camisetas y calcetines. Su padre de quien inicio con el negocio pero el ya no esta en la edad para seguir dirigiendo ahora e ella quien lo administra de hecho lleva 3 años y es base ha esta actividad comercial que sus hijos y su padre sobreviven. Ella realizo el préstamo para compra de ropa interior, camisetas, calcetines, medias para damas . A medida que su negocio vaya creciendo le gustaría ofrecer mercadería mas variada e ir haciéndoles mejoras a su tramo.
texts.en:
Celia is a businesswoman. She is 36-years-old, has two children, and lives in the city of Granada. She works together with her father selling underwear, T-shirts, and socks. Though she began the business with her father, he is no longer of the age to go on managing it and she has wound up running it for three years. It's on this business that her children and father depend to survive. 

She is requesting this loan to buy underwear, T-shirts, socks, and ladies' stockings. As long as her business continues growing, she would like to offer more varied merchandise and go on making improvements to her site.

loans.use: to buy underwear, T-shirts, socks, and ladies' stockings

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está en casado y vive con su hija y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende compra los insumos para asistir su cafetal como los abonos y pago de mano de obra. El cuenta con un terreno ya establecida con la plantación de café y necesita una muy buena asistencia este año por lo cual opto por el crédito. El quiere darle a su cafetal una buena mejora pues esta cosecha pasado se deterioro mucho su plantación. El espera con este que le hará a su proyecto mejorarlo en condiciones y obtener de el los mejores resultados para así generar una mejor cosecha este próximo año y salir con los pagos del crédito y mejora su estabilidad económica y el bienestar de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Luis, 46, is married living with his daughter and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure for his coffee crops and also to pay labor costs.  He has a field already planted with coffee and needs good assistance for it this year which is why he opted for the loan.  He wants to improve his coffee plantation because last year it was greatly deteriorated.  He hopes that with it he’ll be able to improve its conditions and get better results from it so that next year his harvest will be better and he will be able to make his loan payments and improve his economic stability and his family’s wellbeing.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR gave him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria de 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene  3 hijos de 26,19 y 15 años de edad todos ellos están estudiando en la actualidad, ella es comerciante tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, vive en la ciudad de Granada. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo con el objetivo de generar otros ingresos que le ayudara a solventar algunos gastos que en su momento no podían pagar pero el negocio fue creciendo poco a poco de la misma manera fue surtiéndolo de mas productos de mucho uso y necesidad para  su vecindario. Ahora se siente muy satisfecha por que es independiente genera sus propios ingresos aporta en el hogar y cuida su familia, lleva 16 años con este negocio. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de mercadería tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, cosméticos, jugos, papel de baño, gaseosas, pan, galletas. Ella esta ahorrando para la graduación de sus hijos pues es una de sus metas principales así como lograr hacer mas sostenible su negocio. Por lo pronto desea seguir trabajando y cancelar su crédito.
texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 26, 19 and 15 years old, all of whom are currently studying. 

She is a shopkeeper and has a grocery store in her home where she lives in the city of Granada. She started her business with the help of her husband, with the goal of generating additional income that would help her pay some expenses that at the moment they couldn't pay. However, the business grew little by little and at the same time was supplying much needed products for her neighborhood. Now, she feels very satisfied because she is independent, and generates her own income to support her home and care for her family. She has had this business for 16 years. She attained this loan in order to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, cosmetics, juices, toilet paper, sodas, bread and cookies. 

She is saving for her children's graduations, as it is one of her main goals, along with making her business more sustainable. In the meantime, she wants to continue working and pay back her loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, cosmetics, juices, toilet paper, sodas, bread and cookies.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está en casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. el con el crédito pretende comprar unas herramientas eléctricas indispensables que le hacen falta para poder elaborar sus construcciones. El tiene ya varios años de desempeñarse en estas labores y necesita ir perfeccionando su acabados por lo cual para facilitar su trabajo y su desempeño en calidad el necesita esta maquinas como el patín de cortar madera, metao y otros más. El con estas maquinas le dará a su clientes mayor eficacia en su trabajo para así complacer a sus clientes con lo que le pidan. El con esto pretende ser contratado por más clientela para la construcción de las necesidades de los clientes a su vez así generar una aumento en las ganancias para el bienestar de su familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Fernando, 36, is married and lives with his three children and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy indispensable electric work tools that he needs for his construction work.  He has been working in this type of work for several years now and he needs to be improving his work to ease his labor and produce better quality work; he needs these machines like an electric saw and others.  With these machines he will be able to provide more efficient work to his customers thus satisfying them in whatever they ask for.  He intends this way to be contracted by more customers for their construction needs and this way he will generate higher profits for his family’s wellbeing every day.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR gave him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushanik runs a little grccery. Her husband helps her with the business. Shushanik would like to increase the sales and make the business more profitable. With the requested loan, Shushanik plans to purchase more goods to sell. Increase in the variety of goods will allow Shushanik to get more income and cover her school-age daughter's  educational costs.

loans.use: to pay for goods to sell

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yamileth, habitante de la ciudad de Granada de 33 años de edad, casada, madre de 6 hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de queso, mantequilla y crema. La idea del negocio nació por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que los ingresos que el ganaba no eran los suficientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Hoy en día lleva 4 años con este negocio , ella vende su queso de manera ambulante su esposo trabaja vendiendo leña y trabajando de acarreo. Es base a esta actividades que su familia vive el día a día. 
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar queso, crema, cuajada, mantequilla. Ella trabaja fuerte y duro cada día para lograr darle lo mejor a sus hijos pues desea lograr tener un tramo estable en mercado.
texts.en:
Yamileth lives in the city of Granada. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is a merchant who makes a living selling cheese, butter and cream. The idea for this business was born out of the need to support her husband and to get ahead with their children, because the income that he was earning was not sufficient to cover the household expenses.  As of now she has had this business for four years. She sells her cheese door to door. Her husband works selling firewood and works in transport. It is based on these businesses that her family lives day to day. 

She requested the loan to buy cheese, cream, curd and butter. She works strong and hard each day to make enough to give the best to her children. She wants to achieve a stable market presence.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curd and butter.

loans.name: Maria Ramona

texts.es:
María, 37 años de edad originaria de Granada, madre de tres hijos, casada, habita en la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante. Ella le gusta ser muy emprendedora, dinámica y proactiva en los negocios ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, chinelas alquila video juegos de Play Station. Empezó poniendo el negocio de Play Station en casa pues notaba que la mayoría de los jóvenes en su barrio le llamaba la atención este tipo de recreación su esposo la apoyo  desde un inicio , su esposo se dedica a vender  chinela y zapatos en el mercado de la ciudad . 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar chinelas y zapatos que parte de la mercadería que mas vende pues son de mucho uso en la población que no tienen acceso a otro tipo calidad de zapato. Por lo pronto uno de sus planes es reforzar su tramo para guardar y mantener su mercadería más segura.
texts.en:
Maria is a 37 year old married woman, who is originally from Granada, and has three children. She lives in Granada and is a business woman. She likes to be very entrepreneurial, dynamic and proactive in business.  She makes a living selling shoes and slippers as well as renting Play Station video games. She started her Play Station video game rental business since she noticed that most young people in her neighborhood were attracted to this form of entertainment.  Her husband supported her from the beginning. 

Her husband sells slippers and shoes in the city market. She is requesting this loan so she can  buy slippers and shoes, which are the items that she sells the most,  since these type of shoes are widely used by people that do not have the means  to buy better quality footwear. In the meantime, one of her plans is to reinforce her business location security to keep her merchandise  more secured.

loans.use: to buy slippers and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.es:
Doña Isidra de 48 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 18 y 21 años de edad, quienes estudian, vive en aldea Rancho Alegre, Taulabe.

Isidra, es muy trabajadora, desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de Rosquillas de pan, miel de abeja, frutas confitadas, dulces y piedra de enchape. Su punto de venta es a la orilla de la carretera, es una zona de producción de miel, es muy típico la venta de rosquillas y dulces y la extracción de piedra. La gente que pasa por el lugar compra estos productos por ser más baratos.  También viaja hacia la comunidad de Tela donde tiene  gran cantidad de clientes que le compran Rosquillas de pan, frutas confitadas y dulces. La piedra de enchape sirve para hacer muros o cercos decorados de viviendas, ella la compra a un precio y la vende a otro dejándole buenas ganancias.
Este es su primer préstamo y lo solicito para invertir en el negocio en compra de Rosquillas de pan, frutas confitadas, miel de abeja y dulces.
Su meta es obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia y darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isidra, 48, is a single mother; she has three children who are 6, 18, and 21 years old and who attend school.  She lives in the village of Rancho Alegre, Taulabe.

Isidra is very hardworking.  She’s been selling bread, honey, candied fruit, candy and paving stones.  Her sales point is alongside a highway.  It’s a honey producing zone and the sale of rosquillas [ring-shaped cookies], candy and stone extraction is very typical here.  People pass by the place and buy these products because they are less expensive.  She also goes to the community of Tela where she has a large number of customers that buy Rosquillas, candied fruit and candy from her.  The paving stones are used to build walls or decorative fences on dwellings.  She buys them at one price and then sells them at another producing good profit for her.

This is her first loan and she requested it to invest in her business.  She will buy Rosquillas, candied fruit, honey and candies.   Her goal is to earn more income to help her family and provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy bread, candy, candied fruit and honey.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamileth ,32 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, habitante de la ciudad de Granada de oficio comerciante, nos expresa su agradecimiento por el cambio positivo que le genero el prestamo pues noto una mejora en sus ventas ya que pudo comprar mas productos para vender y siente que su negocio va avanzando poco a poco. Ahora requiere un segundo credito para comprar granos basicos, enlatados, sopas, sazonadores, salsa de tomates, productos de limpieza. Con esta nueva inversion piensa incrementar las ventas para hacer prosperar su negocio y lograrlo establecer con mas variedad y le permita salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Yamileth is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She is an inhabitant of the city of Granada and works as a merchant. 

She expressed to us her gratitude for the positive change that her loan generated. She noticed an improvement in sales, as she was able to buy more products to sell and she feels that her business is progressing, little by little. 

She now requires a second loan to buy basic grains, canned goods, seasonings, tomato sauce, and cleaning products. With this new investment, she thinks she can increase her sales, so that her business will propser and allow her to get a wider variety of products, as well as help her move forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, meat and cleaning products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en: Sirush works at the local school as a teacher. To meet her family's needs, she is also engaged in cattle raising. Unfortunately, current income from this still is not adequate to save enough to renovate the house. With the help of this loan Sirush will increase the number of cattle and develop farming. This means additional income and improved living conditions for Sirush and her family. Development of farming will also allow Sirush's son to come back from abroad, get engaged in agriculture, and sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is married and lives in Malindi, Kenya. He uses his motorcycle to ferry people and goods around the area. He started the business four months ago after purchasing the motorcycle. Jonathan was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase fruit and vegetables in order to open up a grocery stall. His main challenge is the low season which begins in February. Jonathan would like to purchase more motorcycles in future and also to begin his grocery stall. He will use the extra income obtained to meet his current needs and invest a section for the future needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables to start a grocery stall

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of 6 school-going children. She owns a ration stall which has been in operation for two years. Besides this business, Sidi also supplies building blocks to construction sites. She is applying for a loan of 25,000 KES to purchase retail stock such as sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.. Her main challenge is the lack of working capital to purchase more stock. Sidi would like to diversify to other areas in the future, like selling clothes. She will use the extra income obtained from this loan to meet the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock such as sugar, flour, cooking oil

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man who lives in Changamwe, Kenya and is an events manager. He began the business four years ago. His main duties are to liaise with event organizers (e.g. weddings, promotions etc), plan out logistics for such events and follow through until they are completed.

He is applying for a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase chairs, tables, tents and fabrics. James was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. His main challenge comes when events are cancelled last minute. 

James looks forward to being established and making his business known. He will reinvest the extra income obtained to expand operations.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, tents and fabrics

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Mombasa, Kenya and owns a retail shop. He is married and a father of one child. His business was started 6 years ago. 

Daniel was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 35,000 KES to purchase shoes and ladies’ handbags. His main challenges are the high cost of imported goods and transport. 

Daniel looks forward to owning a large store and opening other shops too in the future. He will use the extra income obtained to invest for future family needs, open a business for the wife, and meet other house needs.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and ladies’ handbags.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man who lives in Changamwe, Kenya, and owns a carpentry shop. The business was started seven years ago. He continues to supply finished woodworks to the customers who live in the area.
 
Stephen was introduced to Kiva partner Milango Financial Services by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES)  to purchase timber and a welding machine. His main challenge is the lack of working capital to purchase advanced materials. Stephen has set his sight on owning a large store or factory in the future dealing in metal and wood works.

He will use the extra income obtained to invest for his family's future needs.

loans.use: To purchase timber and a welding machine.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has two school-going children. Ronald owns a vehicle-repair garage, a business he began five years ago. After being introduced to Milango Financial Services by his friends, Ronald is now applying for a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase spare parts to use in vehicle repairs. The business has many customers due to the fact that there are few specialized mechanics in this area for three-wheeler vehicles, and many clients like to work with trusted mechanics.

Ronald faces the challenge of lack of capital to purchase spare-parts stock. He looks forward to opening other centers in the future, and he will use the extra income to cater for his family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to use in vehicle repairs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has four children. 

Margaret owns a salon which has been in operation for 20 years. She began by plaiting from her own residence before moving to a new place. She was introduced to Milango Financial Services by a company employee.

Margaret is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase hair dryers and a few clothes to sell. Her main challenge is finding customers. She would like to own a hair-design center in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair dryers and a few clothes

loans.name: Muhiyo

texts.en:
Muhiyo lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He started shaving under the shade using blades. He purchased machines and continued to shave. He later obtained a room to carry out the hair cuts. Muhiyo has run this business for two years. 
Muhiyo learnt of Milango from a friend and is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase a battery, chargers and extensions to be able to serve more customers. 
Since he has not perfected the business, he faces the challenge from other competitors who can offer most of what customers need. He has set his sight to open a big center in future.

loans.use: To purchase a battery, chargers and extensions

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has two school going children. He supplies building materials within the town; a business he has run for the last four years. 
Besides this, he also owns rental houses. Dickson learnt of Milango from a friend and joined the organization to obtain credit.
His major challenges include lack of capital and competition from established entrepreneurs. Dickson is applying for a loan of Ksh 80,000 to purchase building materials. He will use the extra income to meet other family needs.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en: Zoya is engaged in agriclture. She lives together with her husband, who helps her with daily agricultural activities. It has been already ten years the couple has been successfully managing the business. Zoya would like to develop the business further, but the agricultural technique is old and doesn't work properly. This loan will help Zoya to renovate the agricultural technique, as well as to purchase corn seeds to cultivate the land. Zoya will develop agriculture and expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: to pay for corn seeds and renovation of agricultural technique

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is engaged in agriculture. As the harvest mostly depands on climate, the current harvest Edgar has received is not enough to sell and get sufficient income. Besides, Edgar wants to purchase seeds to cultivate his land. This loan will allow Edgar to get additional income from the sales of fruit and develop his farm. Agricultural development means sustainable and prosperous future for Edgar's family. Edgar lives together with his wife, mother and one child.

loans.use: to pay for fruit and seeds

loans.name: 24 De Mayo (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte que se encuentra al Norte de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, se  reúnen cada quince días las 10 socias y 2 socios del Banco Comunal 24 de Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años que  estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos desde hace varios años se dedica a la preparación y venta de dulces, los cuales prepara  todos los días y luego los entrega a comerciantes de la zona y estos venden en otras ciudades, lo que más le piden sus clientes es el manjar de leche que es delicioso y por esto la prefieren.

Este crédito lo va  a invertir para comprar ingredientes útiles para preparar los dulces como: azúcar, leche, frutas, etc. Es su primer crédito y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir el crédito.
 
Su sueño es que su hijo menor termine sus estudios y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The ten female and two male members of the “24 de Mayo” communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton located in the north of the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the residents make that are famous nationwide.  The members carry out a variety of activities like general commerce and services, among others.  They joined forces to access benefits from Fundación Espoir.  This is their first cycle in the communal bank and they expect to be responsible in order to continue forward with the institution.

We met Mariana, 53, here.  Her husband died several years ago and she has five children.  Four of them are adults now and the youngest is 14 years old and they go to school; three of them still live with her.

She is a very good mother and housewife who in order to support her children has been making sweets to sell for several years now.  She makes them every day and then sells them to local merchants who then resell them in other cities.  What her customers request the most is “manjar de leche” which is delicious and this is why they prefer it.

She will use this loan to buy useful ingredients to make the sweets like: sugar, milk, fruit, etc.  This is her first loan and she likes it because of the speed in getting it.  Her dream is that her youngest son finishes his schooling and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. Choem is 41 years old and is a mother of 6 children, living in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. To earn a living, she has been engaged in fresh fish selling business, from which she can generate an average of $2 per day. One of her children is the one who helps to catch fish from the river for her. However, she also buys those fish from the villagers or her fish suppliers. This amount of her income is not enough to cover her daily expenses but she enjoys doing this business in order to assist her husband in earning income. Her husband, Mr. Mom, is an experienced and skillful carpenter who is able to earn a good profit to support this family. But presently Mr. Mom needs additional carpentry supplies to perform his work sufficiently and to keep his business improves. So now Mrs. Choem, his wife, decided to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase carpentry supplies for her husband such as plane machine, chisel machine and other tools that have different functions. She hopes to uplift her family out of poverty and to provide her children further educations.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry supplies such as plane machine, chisel machine and other tools that have different functions.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor is 33 years old and a mother of three children, living in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows rice and vegetable crops. Most of her income is from selling vegetables, which she harvests from her fields as well as buys from her suppliers. She is able to earn approximately $3.00 per day to solve the financial needs and support her children to school.

Mrs. Sor is requesting this loan from HKL and Kvia to buy a used motorcycle to support her business, and with remaining funds, she will buy a stock of vegetables for consistent sale.
This loan will provide her a good opportunity to sustain her business. In the future, she intends to own store for selling merchandise products as well as vegetables in a local market of the province.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle and a stock of vegetables for consistent sale.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en: Hakob lives together with his wife, parents and children. He has been engaged in agriculture for already 12 years. Now Hakob would like to develop his farm. With the help of the loan he will purchase seeds, as well as fruit to keep in the freezer and sell it till he gets harvest next year. The children are growing, so are their needs. Hakob wants to insure his family is fed and his children are educated. Development of agriculture will help Hakob to implement these purposes.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fruits

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a farmer from Aragatsavan. He lives together with his wife and two children. Agriculture is the family's main source of income and it's barely enough to cover daily costs and save means. Unable to find sufficient financial means to purchase forage, Edgar has applied for a loan. With the loan's help Edgar will sustain the cattle with forage and keep his farm stable and develop it in the future.

loans.use: to pay for forage

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives with her husband and two children. The family gets its main income from keeping cattle and land cultivation. The current number of income does not incur enough income for Anush to save for her children's education in the future. This loan will help Anush to increase the number of cattle, as well as to purchase seeds to cultivate the land. Anush will get additional income and insure better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and seeds

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 43 years old woman (husband Mohammad is shown).  She is married and has four sons and one daughter.  

Her husband is a stone cutting and earns a low income.  Fatema wants to help her husband purchase a new stone cutting machine to improve his workshop and increase his income.  Neither has enough money to buy one.

She needs to take a loan in the amount $1,000 from FATEN.  Fatema hopes to create a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new stone cutting machine.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is engaged in agriculture. She cultivates land. Narine has applied for a loan to purchase  tomato and potato seeds and fertilizer. Successful cultivation of the land will help Narine to develop her farm and get additional income. This is vital for Narine's family, as it will allow her to meet the ends and insure prosperous future. Narine lives together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to pay for tomato and potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Nadia sells used clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more used clothes to sell.

Nadia is looking to open a shop for her business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattel and cultivates land. The income Armine gets is barely enough to sustain her family, and she isn't able to make savings to develop her farm. So she has applied for a loan. With the requested loan Armine plans to purchase pigs and forage. This loan will allow Armine to expand her farm and increase her income. Armine will insure stable future for her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 37-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Hanan is a tailor and she is working from her home. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase a new sewing machine.

Hanan is looking to expand her business and sales volume through having more than one sewing machine.

Due to cultural issues, Hanan's husband agreed to be photographed in her place.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 48-year-old divorced woman from Madaba, Amman.

Hanan is requesting a loan of 600 JD to do maintenance on her house.

Hanan is looking to have enough money to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 43-year-old woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Maha is a tailor working from home and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials. 

Maha is looking to adding a dry cleaning line so that she could expand the scope of her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en: Andranik is engaged in agriculture. He keeps a glasshouse. Andranik needs some financial investments to develop his business. With the requested loan he plans to purchase seeds to grow flowers, as well as fruits to keep in the freezer and sell it during winter. This will allow Andranik to get additional income from flowers' and fruits' sales and improve his family's living conditions. Andranik lives together with his wife, father and one child.

loans.use: to pay for flower seeds and fruits

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 46-year-old woman from Al-Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to do maintenance work on her house. Amal is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 22-year-old single man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Haitham is requesting a loan of 900 JD to finance his higher education fees.

Haitham is looking to graduate and get a good job to improve his family life conditions.

loans.use: To finance his education

loans.name: Somaiah

texts.en:
Somaiah is a 30-year-old woman from Madab, Jordan. 

Somaia is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to purchase raw materilas needed for her home based 0 project such as cloth and thread. 

Somaia is looking to open a shop for her business. 

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Somaia's brother.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and thread for her business

loans.name: Rowaidah

texts.en:
Rowaidah is a 36-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan. She is a mother of five children.
Rowaidah makes handmade accessories from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase beads. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beads.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 50-year-old woman from Al Hasmi, Amman; Jordan. 

Muna is a Henna-Henna artist; it is a traditional material used to dye skin, particulary the hands and legs. This type of tattoo is very common in the Middle East, especially at parties where the bride usually has such paintings on her legs and hands. 

Muna is requesting a loan of 1000 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase materials needed to make Henna such as the Henna plant.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for her business such as the Henna plant

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 50-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of seven children. 

Dalal trades in clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase clothes for trading purposes. 

Dalal started her business with a small amount of capital, then she expanded her project, and now she is looking to expand her home-based project and open a shop for her products.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Shaimaa

texts.en:
Shaimaa is a 28-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. 

Shaimaa sells milk and other dairy products and she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase materials needed for making dairy products. 

Shaimaa is looking to improve the income of her family. 

Due to cultural issues the woman in the photo is Shaimaa's mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making dairy products

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 28-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of two children. 

Ghadeer sells clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more products for trading purposes. 

Ghadeer is looking to improve her income and provide enough money to finance the education of her children. 

Due to cutural issues the woman in the photo is Ghadeer's mother.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 28-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. 

Noor is trading in clothes from home and is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more clothes for trading purposes. 

Noor is looking to expand her business and improve the family income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a 23-year-old woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. 

Enas makes handmade accessories from her home and is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase beads needed for the project. 

Enas is looking to expand her project and improve her family's living conditions. 

Due to cultural issues the man in the photo is Enas's brother.

loans.use: to purchase beads for her business

loans.name: Noora

texts.en:
Noora is a 40-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan and a mother of three children. 

Noora is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 47-year-old widow from Madaba, Jordan who has five children. 

Haya is requesting a loan of 300 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance for her house and she is looking to improve her family's living conditions through starting a business for herself.

loans.use: to do house maintenance

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 41-year-old housewife. She has two sons and two daughters. Her second son, Samer, is 23 years old and is in his fourth year studying for a banking and finance major at university. Because of the university’s high fees, Samer has a part-time job to help his family, who are paying for his college fees. Unfortunately, it is not enough, so his mother Salam has applied for a loan to pay for a semester so Samer can continue and eventually graduate to work in the banking field.
Because Salam is a conservative person, her son Samer has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay a semester's fees.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 35-year-old housewife who has four daughters and one son; her oldest are twins. 

Five years ago she started a small retail business selling clothes, but before selling her clothes items she always added her touch on every piece whether by sewing a drawing on it or attaching a pin to it before selling them. 

Now Rania has applied for this loan in order to buy new clothes for sale in larger quantities and at lower prices.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 42-year-old housewife and a mother to six children. Her husband Wajeeh works as a truck driver who collects scrap and junk. 

To be able to support their big family Wafaa decided to help her husband by doing what she is good at, which is making different types of pickles such as olive pickles and eggplant pickles. 

After making those pickles and packing them in special containers, she sells them to the nearby food markets, besides taking orders from her friends and neighbors. 

Now Wafaa has applied for a loan to make more pickles so she can distribute them to more supermarkets and food shops.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for making pickles and to buy new containers

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is 33 years old. She is a housewife and a mother to four children. 

Her husband Nashaat works in one of the Jordanian ministries, following specific working hour shifts. Sanaa and her husband work together in their small food products store, they also have a section in the store that sells cleaning products that are used in homes. 

Now Sanaa has applied for a loan to buy new products for the store to attract more customers in their area. 

Because Sanaa is a conservative person, her husband Nashaat has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy new products for the food store

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 31-year-old single lady who is passionate about kids. 

Four years ago Maha started a small daycare at her house to help working mothers taking care of their children; she has arranged her house to be a safe place for the kids to play. 

Now Maha wants to bring in more toys and build a larger daycare for kids between the age of two months up to seven years separated from her house, in order to start that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring in more toys and build a larger daycare

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is a married man having four children. Eleazar is 45 years old, residing at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Eleazar owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and his been 11 years in this business. Each month, he earns 5,010.00 doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of 40,000.00 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Eleazar is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Eleazar hopes to purchase land for expanding the business to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Miss Vong is a 31-year-old single woman who has been living with her husband in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. Presently she is in the business of selling some types of fruits like mangoes, grapefruits, pineapples and other fruits by walking from place to place. She typically earns an average of $3.00 per day through her business and tries very hard to gain her income. She wishes to make changes her business in order to generate a good income and to make her life more comfortable. She wants to borrow some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle, and then connect it with a trailer at the side, from which she can sells her fried meatballs, bread filled with meat and pickle, pounded papaya (Khmer fast food) and some drinks. She hopes that all lenders will approve her loan and support her in this business.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and has 9 children. Editha is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Editha has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to send her 3 children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Beatrxye

texts.en:
Beatrxye is a 57-year-old widow. Her husband passed away in 1980. Now Beatrxye is living with her parents, her children are all married and living at their own house. They are: Dody, 37; Maisye, 35; Yami, 33; and Diana, 30. 

Being widowed for years has given Beatrxye much worthwhile experience to survive. To make a living, Beatrxye sells a variety of cakes, banana crispy chips, fried corn, and pastries; she also provides a catering service. The income is used to add to her capital and for living expenses. 

Beatrxye is planning to improve her business and therefore she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). She plans to buy four sacks of wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc. to produce a greater variety of cakes and pastries as ordered by the customers for Christmas celebration.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc

loans.name: Frans

texts.en:
Frans is a 45-year-old man who is married to Petronela, a 42-year-old lady. Frans and his wife have been blessed with three children: Natrianus, 24 and married; Semri, 17, and working at Kalimantan; Nuryati, 14, and studying in the 3rd grade of junior high school.
Frans runs a kiosk business selling basic daily items such as sugar, tea, coffee, cooking oil, snacks etc. He also sells some kinds of vegetable. He started the business one year ago. Frans also set up a mini stall besides the kiosk to sell petrol. 
Frans dreams of enlarging the business but he has no more capital to make it happen. Therefore he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner TLM amounting to 7,500,000 IDR to buy kiosk items such as a greater variety of snacks and nine basic daily items. He also wants to purchase scrap metal from a collector to resell it. Through the loan, Frans really hopes to provide a better life for his beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk items such as a greater variety of snacks and nine daily basic items, plus purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a nipa (palm tree leaves) weaving business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to weave.

Janet has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of nipa to weave

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and single. 

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as softdrinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, etc.

In the future Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak, 26, is an industrious and responsible housewife who has been residing in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. She is a rice farmer and a mother of a single child attending a local primary school. Her family entirely depends on her husband who earns a profit by driving cars for a company. She would like to take out this loan to pay for mechanical repairs of her plowing machine, which was broken in the previous month. She thanks the financial institution for their constant support which enables her to achieve her projects in farming.

loans.use: to pay for mechanical repairs of her plowing machine.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 28 years old and married with 2 children. With 2 children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, ice candy, etc.

In the future Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en: Feliza is 53 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent with two children, both of whom are married. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living by running a farm where she grows pineapples and bananas. She sells her goods to people who live in her community and earns about PHP 400 a day. She is applying for a loan for PHP 39,000 to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her farm. Her goal is to grow her business in the coming years. She regularly attends our fellowship meetings, where she studies the bible, builds social capital and repays loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 31 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Remelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Remelyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from farming vegetables.

Remelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with three children. She is 31 years old since she was born on April 13,1980 and is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Elvie is operating a business venture selling seafood products including fish, crabs, and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for four years. She earns 51,750 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Elvie is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
This is Maria Nenita, a 59-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five-Philippine pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maria Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Saranjav

texts.en: Mrs. Saranjav is 39 years old and earns a living by making the covers for the traditional Mongolian nomadic tents which are known as gers. She has been in this line of work for eight years and sells her goods to wholesalers. She lives with her husband and her daughters in a ger in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. All of her daughters are in secondary school. Her goal for the future is to earns more money by increasing her sales volume. She is in a good business for doing this, because gers are seen as essential items in Mongolia.

loans.use: to buy more wool for making ger covers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 44 years old, married and has two children. For the last eight years, she has worked hard at earning a living by running a sari sari or variety store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF and Kiva to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell to her customers. This is her sixth loan, and she has repaid the previous five fully and on time. Her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers/

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is 40 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married, the father of one child and earns a living by running a jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. His jeepney can hold 14-16 people who live in his area and pay him daily. He earns PHP 1,600 a day and is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 to maintain his vehicle and buy spare parts. Joey believes that this loan will increase his income because it will allow him to improve his service. His goal is to earn enough money to allow his child to finish her education. He is a regular attendee of our fellowship meetings, where we study the bible and repay microfinance loans.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers who were helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, turned these vehicles into a source of income and today they are one of the things which make the Philippines truly Philippines.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintain a jeepney.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 45 years old, married and has one child. For the last six years, she has earned a living by working hard in her sari sari (or variety) store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF and Kiva to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by working as a farmer and hopes to earn enough money to expand her sari sari business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ninfa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Liberito

texts.en:
Liberito is married with five children.  He is 44 years old and resides at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, the Philippines.

Liberito is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living.  He has been two years in this business.  Each month he earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business.

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  Liberito has been a member of GDMPC for three years.  In the future, Liberito wants to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Edelia

texts.en:
Edelia is 62 years old, a widow with five children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell.

Edelia has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Edelia would like to save money to expand her business and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
This is Apolonia, 43, resident of Silang Cavite, the Philippines. She is married to Nelson, a jeepney driver, and a mother to her three children. By the grace of God Apolonia has managed to support her children's schooling. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses 

Apolonia oversees operations of her jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which covers her costs each day. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and parts for her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Apolonia dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rocyll

texts.en:
Rocyll is 35 years old and married with two children.

Rocyll works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rocyll has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from frozen foods and farming rice.

Rocyll aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Villarosa

texts.en:
Villarosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
 
She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for twelve years. She earns more income from buying and selling oysters.

Villarosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Neziel

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Neziel works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Neziel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell during market day for her ambulant vending business.

Neziel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell during market day.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Mrs. Sot, 63, is a humble farmer from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She lives there permanently with her partner and three children. 

During December Mrs. Sot’s rice is ripe enough to harvest and, as usual, she hires some local laborers to work in her rice fields. However, she has inadequate money to pay for the laborers. So Mrs. Sot has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for laborers to help with harvesting and threshing her rice crops.
 
In the future, she hopes that she will be able to fix some necessary parts of her house.

loans.use: to pay for laborers for harvesting and threshing her rice crops.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Josephine has been in this business for twenty years. She earns more income from retailing rice and farming rice.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Navchaa

texts.en:
Navchaa, 26, runs a retail business of beautification commodities such as bandeaux, earrings, etc. She has been in this business since 2003 and has gained a lot of experience in her business field. 

She lives with her husband and her younger son in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her business has been running during the last several years and she has bought a car using her earnings in the last year. Now this car is used as a taxi for her husband’s business. 

Now Navchaa needs some money to purchase from her suppliers more beautification commodities to prepare for her sales for the coming holidays. Because of the New Year and traditional celebrations, there will be many more sales in the markets of Mongolia. 

This increase in sales will be beneficial and provide a big chance for her to increase her income in a year. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.name: Edendo

texts.en:
Edendo is a married man from the town of Luna in the province of Isabela. Edendo and his wife are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Edendo does his best to improve their business and take care of their three children.

At this time, Edendo is requesting a loan of P30,000 to purchase quality seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Edendo hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase quality seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is from Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Lydia is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Lydia is running a general store selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many more.  Lydia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for these activities.

Lydia is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  In 2010, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 38 years old and married with three children.

Nora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nora has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

Nora aspires to build and expand her business to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mrs Baasansuren is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She sells clothes in the market called Narantuul, which is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar. She has been selling clothes for three years and she has gained a little experience in her business.  Currently her business earnings the main source of income for her family.  Therefore she always tries to increase her earnings by improving her business in day by day.  

Now Baasansuren needs some financial support to purchase winter clothes for her sales in preparation for the coming winter season because the price of winter clothes is more expensive than other seasonal clothes in Mongolia.  Winter is a big chance to increase her income in the year. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of winter outfits for her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of winter outfits for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Melayn

texts.en:
Melayn is 42 years old and married with seven children.

Melayn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell.

Melayn has borrowed and paid back four previous loans from NWTF.  She has been running her tobacco retail business for ten years and also earns an income from the buying and selling of vegetables.

Melayn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 29 years old and married with two children.

Annaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Annaliza has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Annaliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Irene has been in this business for 15 years. She explains that she earns additional income by raising pigs.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her tricycle transport business. Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Ma. Sanny

texts.en:
Ma. Sanny is a 47-year-old, married woman with eight children.

Ma. Sanny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store. Notably, Ma. Sanny has already borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years, and she earns additional income from a restaurant. Ma. Sanny aspires to build and expand her business to secure a good future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is a 48-year-old, married man with four children. He and his family live in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Emiliano operates a service-based business; specifically, he provides transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for ten years, and every month he earns approximately 10,800 PHP from this work.

Emiliano is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle so that he can provide better service to his customers. He has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Emiliano hopes to double his business income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to provide better service by repairing his existing vehicle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
A very responsible and loving mother, Marilyn is 47 years old with two grown children. She is married to Romeo. Her spouse works as a farmer in the community. Marilyn is busy managing her store, where she sells different kinds of products. Marilyn is well known in the community and is a very responsible person.

Marilyn is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase a variety of products that she can display in her small store like canned goods, snack foods, and drinks so that her income increases and she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, spices, snack foods, and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 50-year-old, married woman with eight children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business where she buys and sells bamboo in the Philippines. She has been running this buiness for 11 years, though she also earns income from selling charcoal, vegetables and coconuts.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell. Notably, Alma has already borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. Alma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional bamboo

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem is widowed and has four children, two of whom are working as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh to support the family.  She is a rice cultivator as well as a hog-raiser from Kompong Cham province.

Due to the lack of a motorcycle, Sem has encountered difficulties with her living expenses. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation.  The motorcycle will help the family avoid transportation expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey has been engaged in his rice farm business for eighteen years and he usually earns P27,000 every crop season. Rey is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. Rey is married to Elmira who helps him manage their farm. According to him, through the income generated from his farm business, he is able to support his family’s needs and to be able to continue sending his children who are currently in school. 

At the moment, he is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his rice production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his rice production

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 45, resident of GMA, Cavite, the Philippines.  Her husband is Pablito, a farmer, and father to her four children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 of cooking oil or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
