Marcos is a widower with two children.  He is 58 years old and resides at Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, the Philippines.

Marcos is operating a fishing business, harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community and he has been four years in this business.  Each month he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business.

He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional fish to raise.  Marcos has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marcos wants to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en:
Ma. Susan is well known in her community as a "jolly and responsible person." She is 49 years old and married to Efren.  They have three adult-aged children. Her spouse works as a farmer. Ma. Susan is busy with her sari-sari store, a community-based store where she can sell different products.

Ma. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase a variety of products that she can display in her store like drinks, spices, coffee and different vegetables. Ma. Susan hopes that someday she can give quality living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase products such as drinks, spices, coffee, and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is 51 years of age, married to Gina, and has three children. They live happily in the village of Luyao. They have plans to uplift their standard of living and to continue sending their children to school and give them a better future. 

Farming is one of Roy’s major sources of income. He plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been in this business for more than eight years and usually earns a profit of PHP 28,000 in every harvest season. 

At this time, Roy is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for the labor costs required for a rice plantation. He believes that this loan will be an enormous help for him to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for the labor costs required for a rice plantation.

loans.name: Vieng

texts.en:
Mrs Vieng, 31, is in the business of selling Khmer cakes and corns on a ferry dock, generating an income of $2.50 per day.  She has a partner and is blessed with two children, one of whom is now working in a beauty salon in New market as a hairdresser to contribute to the family’s expenses.

Today Mrs Vieng is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a stock of fresh fish, from which fish-paste can be made for future sale.  She will use the rest of the loan to purchase more cakes and corns to sell.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fresh fish and  to purchase more cakes and corns to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora, 51 years of age, is married to Loreto and works as a farmer. Aurora is engaged in selling different products in their community. She would do anything for the benefit of her family. Aurora is requesting a loan of P 50,000 to purchase coffee, noodles, drinks, shampoo, and soap for her sari-sari store (community-based store).

Aurora hopes that someday she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as drinks, noodles, coffee, shampoo, and soap for her store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a married woman from the town of Luna, in the province of Isabela, Philippines. She and her husband are both farmers who primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Marlene has requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farming supplies.

Marlene does her best to improve their business and take care of their children. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future, and to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
Mrs Hy earns a living by selling fresh vegetables in a local market of Prey Chor district.  She buys vegetables in bulk from her frequent suppliers and then retails for a profit, earning an average of $2.5 per day. To share the income, her husband works as a casual worker around the province. This couple is blessed with four children, who are students and live under their income. 

Now, Mrs Hy would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a pumping machine, pipe and fertilizer for growing her vegetable crops. This loan will enable her business to improve and provide her family with a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine, pipe and fertilizer for growing her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. Together with her husband and children, Wilma manages their household while operating her accessories stall. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Wilma buys accessory items from a wholesaler and sells them at a profit. Her products include hair clips, head bands, and bags. Customers are attracted to buy due to Wilma's low prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Wilma is requesting a loan for 48,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Wilma dreams of expanding her store and helping her children through all her hard work in her business. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of accessory items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mr Chum is a humble rice cultivator who has been residing in Kampong Chhnang province. He has been engaged in this business since 1990 and his wife also helps and works along with him on their farmland. Most of his income is generated from agriculture. 

Presently one of his children is engaged to be married.  Therefore, Mr Chum decided to look for some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to prepare his child’s wedding party.  With the remaining funds he plans to pay for the mechanical repair of his ploughing machine, which broke last time.

loans.use: to prepare his child’s wedding party and pay for the mechanical repair of his ploughing machine.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to improve her business.  With the loan she wants to fix water pipes in her house and purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon business.  She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing more equipment to meet her customers' needs. Her family's living standards have improved due to more income in the business.

loans.use: to fix water pipes in her house and purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Ndumbu Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ndumbu SHG Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Ndumbu SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Irene will save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Ndumbu SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman having four children.  Annie is 38 years old, residing at Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, ZDS, the Philippines. 

Annie owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living.  She has been eight years in this business.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  Annie has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Annie hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, "a woman with dedication for her work and obligation in life", she is 61 years old married to Eulogio. Rebecca is busy managing her vegetable store, where she sells different vegetables in the community. Rebecca is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional vegetables for her little store to have more to offer the people in the community. Rebecca hopes that someday she can achieve her dream for her children to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, cabbages, squash and bananas for her store.

loans.name: Pekeshe

texts.en: Pekeshe is taking another Kiva loan of KES 10,000 to start another beauty salon business.  With the loan she wants to purchase a blow dryer, hair oil and hair weaves.  Her previous loans have improved her family's living standards and her net income has increased by fifty percent.  She dreams of establishing a cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a blow dryer, hair oil and hair weaves.

loans.name: Tete Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tete Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Tete group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a good maize yield harvesting 22 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tete group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Age 37, Lay is married with two children who are dependents and still in school. Being a farmer who has been farming on her farm for more than 13 years in a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district, she sometimes works for others to supplement her income to feed her family. She earns less than 4 U.S. dollars (USD) per day and can save less than 1 USD from her current business. 

Lay is the second cycled client who completely repaid her first loan in 2010 with VisionFund. After the first loan, she had enough regular income to regularly feed her family and send her children to school. She now is applying for another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more rice and earn more income to set aside some savings to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom is a 36-year-old mother, and is married with two children who are still in school. Residing in a village where rice farming is common, she has been farming for more than 20 years as her main income source, supplementing her income by buying and selling salt. 

Rom is a second-cycle client who successfully paid back her first loan in 2010 to VisionFund; she earns less than 3 U.S. dollars (USD) per day and sets aside less than 1 USD for saving. After the loan, she has regular income to regularly send her children to school. Now Rom is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for her farm. She will use some of the loan to buy salt for sale. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and her business, which will enable her to earn more income to build up some savings and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm and salt for sale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is an optimistic man. According to him, although his family often suffers from financial shortage, they are still happy and sometimes they just laugh at their current situation. The family plants corn seeds and harvests the corn upon maturity. They rely solely on the profits gained from corn production.  

Alberto is 44 years old and married to Dolores. They have five children, three of them attending school and in need of daily allowances. Alberto would like to continuously finance his children's schooling. He aims to make his crop more productive. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and corn seeds to grow. With his patience and perseverance, Alberto hopes that someday his family will live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and corn seeds

loans.name: Corbanga

texts.en: Corbanga is a 64-year-old widow. She is a very patient and hardworking person. Corbanga is engaged in selling different vegetables to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits that she can offer in the community. Corbanga, at her age, still hopes to find ways to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, squash, cabbage and tomatoes

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Reth, 52, is widowed and has two children living in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district. Being a farmer who has been farming on her farm for more than 30 years as her main income source, she sometimes works for others to raise additional income to feed her family. She earns less than 2 U.S. dollars (USD) per day.

Reth is a second-cycle client who completely repaid her 2010 loan with VisionFund. After that loan, she has regular income. She now is applying for another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm for 50 USD. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more rice and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Fadhili Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Fadhili group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Fadhili group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
Vibian is a married woman who has two children. She is 40 years old, and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines.

Vibian owns and operates a business venture, making and selling nipa huts to local businesses and community members, and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials in making nipa huts. Vibian has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Vibian wants to make improvements of her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials in making nipa huts.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a 35 year old married woman with 3 school-aged children. She has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She had been doing this work for five years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 300.

Olga is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell to the people of the community. She hopes that, through the loan, she can obtain more customers.

In the future, Olga hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Neangtouch

texts.en:
Neangtouch is a 49-year-old mother, divorced with two children; one of them is dependent and still in school.  She lives in a small thatched roof house in a rural area where rice farming is common.  She has been farming for more than 30 years for her main source of income and supplements her income by planting cassava and sometimes works for others to raise additional income. 

Neangtouch is the second cycled client who earns less than three U.S. dollars per day. She successfully paid back her first loan to VisionFund.  After the loan she has enough regular income to send her children to school.  Now requesting another loan, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and plant cassava for her farm.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn better income to set aside some money to buy a zinc roof for her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plant cassava on her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old, married to Gregorio and has 10 children. Their small house is located in the village of Estefania. To make a living, the couple are involved in corn production as the primary source of their income. Income generated from the business is only just sufficient for all their expenses, because of the large family they possess. Because of poverty, they can't afford to educate all of their children up to college. Four of the children have only had the chance to finish high school. The rest have settled into marriage but still depends on their parents. 

As a mother, Lolita's responsibility doesn't end there, she still helps her children in times of need. Lolita now has decided to borrow an amount of PHP20,000 to maintain her cornfield. She will buy fertilizers and pesticides used to ensure good crop production.

Someday, Lolita hopes to achieve financial stability for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Sarorn, aged 48, is widowed with only one child. She earns a living by working for others, which is her main source of income.  With her current business she earns less than two U.S. dollars per day. 

Sarorn has been with VisionFund since 2009.  After taking previous loans, she has had sufficient food and decent clothing. Now requesting another loan, she will use it to buy rice for her daily food.  With this loan, she hopes to build on some savings to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy rice for her daily food.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bunly's Group

texts.en:
Bunly is 47 years old, married and living in a flat area of the Ponhea Krek district. To earn a living from day to day, she has been farming on her farmland for twenty years.  She supplements her income by raising pigs for sale.  In addition, her husband is a house builder in the local area.  With her current income source, she earns less than seven U.S. dollars per day. 

Having been with VisionFund since 2010, with a successful business and good repayments, Bunly now leads a group of two members applying for another loan from VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and buy feed for her pigs for US $250.  She hopes to increase her crop yield, feed her pigs to be fat and healthy and also hopes to earn more to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district, Ra is a 43-year-old mother of six children, five of whom are dependent and two of whom are still in school while the other three work at the farm and elsewhere.  She feeds her big family by planting cassava as her main source of income but she supplements this by working for others.  With her current business, she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day to feed her big nuclear family. 

Now Ra leads a group of two members and is requesting her first loan from VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  This loan will enable her to grow cassava to increase her business for more income and to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sai's Group

texts.en:
Sai is a 27-year-old mother of two pre-school children. Living in a village of the Ponhea Krek district, she and her husband have been farming and planting cassava for five years to make a living. She supplements her income by raising pigs for sale and sometimes also by working for other people. 

With her current daily income of around four U.S. dollars, she is requesting her first group loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this will help her to grow more rice and cassava so as to earn larger income. This will allow her to feed her family better and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been operating her retail store for eighteen-years and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about PHP500 a day and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Susan suffered difficulties in her business due to many unpaid credit charges from her customers. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of PHP15,000 to allow her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items for her general store business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items for her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is married with four children.  He is 54 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora, ZDS: Philippines.

To earn a living Ricardo operates a business venture, planting and harvesting corn to sell in the local community.  He has been in business for three years. Each month, he earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ricardo has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Ricardo hopes to expand his business to continue to meet daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia believes that, through patience and hard work, her family will survive poverty. She is a hard-working mother who is engaged in her retail shop business to help her husband in financing the education of their children, who are still studying. Because of the high costs of school fees and commodities, Leticia aims to improve her small sari-sari store business to satisfy her children's basic necessities.

Leticia sells different products in their community home base, but her capital is not sufficient to acquire the products for her store. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, baked breads and other items to sell in the village. She mentioned that this loan will help her situation, to make the business grow as she continues to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, baked breads and other items to sell in the village.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods, shampoo, soap and bread. Rona works hard to support her family and, through her business, she is able to help provide for her family's daily needs.

Rona has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, packaged noodles and soap. Rona hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, packaged noodles and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca’s family is her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life. She supports her family by doing something that brings additional income and allows her to support her children. She has had a retail store based in their home for ten years. The daily net profit of 300 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. 

To improve her income in the store, Rebecca is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. Rebecca says the loan will be very helpful in the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
This is Luz.  She is 47 years old and a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio, an employee, and mother to her six children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide a steady income to meet their everyday expenses.

Luz is a mineral water distributor. She buys mineral water in five-gallon containers from wholesalers and resells them individually to earn a profit. She also earns additional income by selling liquid soap and detergent products to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy more mineral water containers. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luz dreams to be able to give all her children a high quality education through working hard on her business. She also hopes to build a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional mineral water containers.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Noy, 30, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area well-known for tourism. Married to a construction worker, Noy is a vegetable and fresh water vendor who is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for transporting her vegetables to market. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to carry her vegetables to market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 28, is married and lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years she has operated a tailoring business; her potential customers are neighbors and passers by. She dreams of establishing new shops in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase clothes materials for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials for resale.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
51-year-old Victoriano is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has four children.

Victoriano tills his land to grow rice crops. He works hard to keep his crops healthy. Victoriano sells his harvest to rice traders. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Victoriano hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. He plans to use his profits to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en: Chantrea, 23, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a traditional basket maker and her husband rents the threshing machine to generate income to support the family. Chantrea has requested a loan of USD 600 to purchase a ploughing machine to plough her own rice field and rental rice fields.  In the future, she would like to run a new business of rice trading and build a new toilet.

loans.use: to purchase a ploughing machine to plough her own rice field and rental rice fields.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 50 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her husband and her father-in-law.  Naira’s daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents; Naira’s son lives in Russia. 

For more than seven years Naira has sold clothes from her own shop.  She retails women’s clothes, underclothes and bathrobes, men’s sweaters and shirts as well.  Once a week Naira goes to Yerevan to buy merchandise and between seasons she buys clothes for her business from a neighboring country.

Thanks to her business income Naira can keep her family, since her husband and father-in-law are jobless.

This is Naira’s seventh loan from Nor Horizon and she always makes her loan repayments on time. 

Now she is seeking a loan of AMD 800,000 to buy winter outerwear to resell.

loans.use: to buy winter outerwear to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 42 years old and is married, but they don’t have child yet. She has a retail store based in her home, and she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell. She has been running her business for nine years. She is thankful because her income has been increasing. Her husband is her motivation for improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she has requested.

loans.use: to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro belongs to a happy family. Though they live less fortunately, they still enjoy life and are thankful for every blessings they have had. He is 49 years old and married to Nilda. The couple has four children. Through their income in corn production, three of his children have finished college. Only one child is still attending school. Isidro and his wife raise corn and sell it upon harvest.

Isidro wanted to increase his output to acquire higher profits but he had insufficient funds, so he is now asking for a loan to use in his corn production. He is asking for PHP20,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Isidro would like to keep producing plentiful harvests for the improvements of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vor

texts.en:
Vor, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its ancient temples.  She runs a grocery store at home and her husband rents sound equipment for weddings and funerals to generate an income to support their family.  Vor has requested a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorcycle to carry groceries from the market to sell at home. 

In the future, she would like to raise pigs, support her children to study to a higher level of education in order to get a good job.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to carry groceries from the market to sell at home.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: Samandar is married and has three children – two of them are students. He is a hardworking and responsible man. Agriculture and fattening up cattle are the scope of his business. He is raising cattle to have milk and cream for sale. Samandar has been involved in livestock for over 20 years and he is a good, experienced farmer. His plans for the future is to buy 25 head of cattle for fattening. He hopes to obtain this loan and earn a good income by expanding his business. He wants to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle.

loans.name: Anne Assiba

texts.fr: Dame Anne, mariée et mère de deux enfants, a pour activité principale la vente des produits cosmétiques, pagnes et mêches. Elle a également un mini-bar dans lequel elle vend des produits SOBEBRA. Elle s'approvisionne dans les autres marchés périfériques deux fois le mois pour les mêches et deux fois par semaine pour les boissons. Pour étendre son activivé et répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle préconise le financement d'un micro-crédit à Finadev. Elle pense aussi à maximiser son profit pour contribuer à ses charges familliales.
texts.en:
Married with two children, Lady Anne's main business activity is to sell cosmetics, pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and hair locks. She also operates a mini-bar where she sells SOBEBRA products.

She resupplies at other markets in the vicinity, twice monthly for the hair locks, and twice a week for beverages.

To expand her activity and respond to her customer's needs, she requested a micro-finance loan from Finadev. She intends to maximize her profits and contribute towards family expenses.

loans.use: buy 20 pagnes and 40 hair locks

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a 25 year old married woman with three children, two of whom are still studying. She has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She had been doing this work for two years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 500 for these activities.

Jenalyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell to the people of the community. She hopes that, through the loan, she can gain more customers.

In the future, Jenalyn hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a retail shop business, selling products in a shop to her neighbours and passers by.  Dorothy dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Rita Agohoue

texts.fr: Rita est mariée et mère de deux enfants. En tant que maîtresse coiffeuse moderne, elle associe à son activité, la vente des produits accessoires et mêches. Elle  s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnantes au moins deux fois par mois pour les mêches. Parfois la cliente se rend dans des marchés hors du bénin pour les approvisionnements si elle y trouve une opprtunité. Pour étendre son secteur d'activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, et surtout améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rita is married with two children. As a modern master hairdresser, she combines her business with the sale of ancillary products and hair locks.

She resupplies at markets in the surrounding area, at least twice a month for the hair locks. Sometimes the client gets supplies from markets outside of Benin if the opportunity arises.

She wants to expand her business, satisfy her customers, and particularly improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: buy 100 hair locks, 25 large boxes of hair-straightening products, 50 small boxes of hair-straightening products, hair pomades and other accessories

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand's priority in life is to make his family financially stable. He cultivates a one-hectare ricefield he inherited from his parents. He only finished his high school education and did not find a stable job, so he just grows corn and sells it to earn his living.

Ferdinand is now 42 years old and blessed with a helpful wife and four children. His wife also raises hogs and future harvests, upon growth. Ferdinand decided to borrow PHP10,000 to buy herbicides and insecticides used in maintaining good growth of his crops.

With determination, hard work and God's guidance, Ferdinand hopes to see all his children earn a degree and pursue their own career someday.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his children.

For the past two years David has operated a barbershop. His customers are neighbors and passersby. Price fluctuations in his business are his major challenge.

David decided to join Yehu to access their loans so as to boost his business. With his 15,000 KES loan he will purchase haircutting supplies and renovate his barbershop.

loans.use: to purchase haircutting supplies and renovate his barbershop.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is 25 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Her husband works in an aluminum shop and is the main source of the family's income. In order to help him,  Khadijeh started a home hair dresser business in 2008. She works with high professionalism and knows very well how to please her clients. 

Khadijeh is requesting a loan for $900 from Ameen s.a.l, which she will use to buy hair dressing tools and supplies. In that way, she will be able to perform her job in a proper way. In the future, she plans to open her own salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair dressing tools and supplies.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is thirty-eight years old and married with three children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Amy has borrowed and repaid twenty-three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seventeen years and also earns an income from ambulant vending vegetables.

Amy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor loves his family a lot so he works untiringly in his one-hectare corn field. He plants and harvests corn and sells to traders. He earns about PHP20,000. He is sending three children to school. Two of his children are in high school and one is in college education, so the income was just enough for their school expenses. Sometimes, the family suffers financial shortage because of their expenses.

Melchor is now asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy two sacks of rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers used in farming.

Someday, Melchor would like to keep producing abundant harvests to earn a higher income and to provide for all of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Jonife

texts.en:
Jonife works hard to support her family. Jonife is single and has a ballot vending business in the Philippines.

Jonife has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional eggs for her business.

Jonife has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jonife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year Mary has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality in her business is her major challenge.

Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans so as to boost her business. With her 10,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Hudson is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Hudson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Hudson takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Hudson had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hudson was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hudson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Hudson will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
This is Precila, 47, resident of GMA, Cavite City, the Philippines. She is married to Luciano, an employee, and is mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Precila is a mineral water distributor.  What she basically does, is to buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and then sell them per container (five gallons per container) at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Precila dreams to be able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can, also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 57, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its ancient temples. She is a housewife. Her husband rents a small motor-driven boat to carry tourists to Baray Tek Thla to generate income to support the family. 

Pov has requested a loan of USD 1000 to buy a small motor-driven boat to rent to tourists at Baray Tek Thla.  In the future she would like to run a restaurant, build a new house and send her children to a good school. 

Note: This man is Pov's husband picture at home.

loans.use: to buy a small motor-driven boat to rent to tourists.

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en: Rawya is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They both work to be able to fulfill their needs and demands.  She opened her own mini market in 2008. She also sells gifts in addition to some artisan products.  As for her husband, he’s benefiting from his retirement compensation. In parallel, he’s working as a farmer and has 21 years of experience in this domain. Today she’s requesting to borrow $1900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her mini market in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her mini market.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with five children all of whom go to school.  She has no other family members.  

Eva sells second hand clothes at the market.  She has been in this business for one year.  She sells her clothes in the shop which she rents.  She sells her clothes on a wholesale basis.  She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more second hand clothes for the upcoming Christmas season.  Her major business challenges are transportation and the increasing price of clothes.  Her goal and aspiration is to buy a car and improve the transportation of her products.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 35 years old, married, and has three children. He had worked as a laborer for two years but he decided to involve himself in corn production. He has been in this field for three years. He grows corn to sell. 

Victor is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes to earn consistent profits from his business.
 
He also wants to improve his farming practices to upgrade his income for the college education of his children, who are currently in their elementary level of education.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a married woman with ten children, two of whom still attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past the ten years, she has operated a business selling maize from home to her neighbours and passers by.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  She dreams of establishing a shop to sell maize at the market in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Lucidel

texts.en:
To make a living, Lucidel has operated her general store for more than five years. She earns a net profit of PHP 150 each day in this business. Her profit is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. 

Lucidel is 31 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To expand her retailing, she is taking out this loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo, and spices to sell. 

Lucidel hopes to further grow her general store and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future and the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo, and spices to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 51 years old and he lives in Pambak village, Lori area, with his mother, wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.  Samson has a higher education and he works at the village school as a geography teacher. Samson’s son and daughter-in-law also work as teachers at the same school. Samson’s mother is a pensioner, and his wife works in village administration.   

Simultaneously with his job at school Samson also engages in farming.  He keeps a cow, a calf, a pig, fifteen chickens and two bee families as well. Samson says that teacher’s salary is not enough to keep a family, so farming helps him to support his family as he uses agricultural produce for his family's use. 

Samson intends to develop his farm and thereto he is asking for an AMD 600,000 loan to buy three young calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy three young calves for his farm.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
This is Eduardo, 53, resident of GMA, Cavite, the Philippines.  He is married to Salvacion, a housewife and mother to their four children.  Eduardo, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business.  At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eduardo maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle unit (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community.  He starts work early in the morning and continues until late in the evening.  There are times when he drives late into the evening until the wee hours in order to earn a bigger profit.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.   He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operating his business, He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.  He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit.  He has to maintain his unit in a good condition in order to have a regular income to satisfy the daily needs of his family. 

Eduardo hopes to buy another tricycle unit and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Pukupuku Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Pukupuku Group in Western Kenya! Dorica is the facilitator of the Pukupuku group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dorica takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Dorica had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dorica was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorica and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Dorica will save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Pukupuku group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wiljohn

texts.en:
Wiljohn was only 22 years old when he started to live on his own. He is married to Kathleen and now blessed with a child. To sustain his family's needs, Wiljohn grows corn to sell, planting and harvesting it from his one-hectare cornfield. He usually earns about PHP 20,000 per harvest, usually during the months of March and October.

Wiljohn currently has insufficient funds to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to use in farming; therefore, he decided to take out a loan of PHP 10,000. He promises to repay this loan on time. He believes that it will surely improve his crop production, his business and their lives as well.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne, 27, is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from the market to her neighbours and passers by.  She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs from home to her place of operation.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale stall selling fish in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira is a 36-year-old Lebanese woman.  After getting divorced, she moved to live with her parents, two working siblings and five other relatives.  Her father and siblings are trying the best they can to enhance their family’s way of living.  For that reason, Nazira opened her own flower shop in 2007, to take some responsibilities off of them; she also decorates bridal cars.  Today, she needs to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to buy additional products for her shop such as flowers and other decoration items.  This will certainly increase the number of customers asking for her services.  In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding a more diverse range of flowers.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her shop such as flowers and other decoration items.

loans.name: Colette Félicité

texts.fr: Colette est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Couturière de formation, elle y ajoute la mercerie à son domicile et les cartes de recharges. Sa périodicité d'approvisionnement dépend de la demande de la clientèle mais se fait sur place dans les marchés environnants. En vue de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante, elle fait recours à Finadev pour l'obtention de prêt visant donc à accroître son stock et surtout améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. La marge bénéficière lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer et de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Colette is married with two children. A seamstress by training, she also sells haberdashery items from her home as well as phone recharge cards. The periodicity at which she resupplies depends on customer demand but is done locally from area markets.

To meet a constantly increasing demand, she has approached Finadev to obtain a loan to increase her stock supply and especially to improve her family's living conditions.

The profit margin will enable her to contribute towards household expenses and address her children's education.

loans.use: buy an assortment of sewing thread spools, zippers and buttons, phone recharge cards, etc.

loans.name: Gardie

texts.en:
Gardie is 22 and still single. He lives with his parents at Dugayung. He only finished high school and his parents can't afford to send him to college. He wanted to help his parents acquire an income for their needs so he plants and harvests corn to sell. He has been doing farming for three years. 

As of now, he is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow. He hopes this loan will be granted to him. It will be a great help in making his crop more productive and allow him to earn for higher revenue to improve their lives too.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow.

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
Monzer is a 54-year-old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife. He has two school-aged children and one other child who works. He really cares about his children's future and wants to do the best he can to see them graduate and achieve high positions. 

For that reason, in 2008, he started to work as a security guard in a local bank.  In parallel, he works as a free-lance taxi driver. 

Today, he is looking to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children's school fees. In this way, they will be able to continue in education until they graduate. 

In the future, he plans to focus on one of his jobs to make more profit and better support his family.

loans.use: to pay his children's educational fees

loans.name: Lulare Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lulare Group in Western Kenya! Florence is the facilitator of the Lulare group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Florence takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Florence will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Lulare group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is from Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old. Clemencia is married and has three grown-up children.

To make a living, Clemencia owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Clemencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Clemencia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for making suman. Suman are Filipino rice cakes steamed in banana leaves.

Recently Clemencia joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as additional investment for her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be saved for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make suman (rice cakes).

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Jean Claude est né au Rwanda et a 37 ans. Il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.

Jean Claude est commerçant. C’est son septième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter les téléphones et leurs accessoires pour les revendre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de sollicite encore plus des crédits pour accroitre son business .Dans les prochaines années, Jean Claude voudrait avoir un bon atelier  de réparation des téléphones. Avec le profit  Jean Claude voudrait assurer le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Claude was born in Rwanda and is 37 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old, three of whom are at school. He has three years of secondary education himself.

Jean Claude is a trader and this is his seventh loan from ACB. He is going to use this loan to buy telephones and accessories for resale.

His strategy for growing his business is to take out more loans. In the coming years he would like to get a good workshop in which to repair telephones. With the profits he makes he would like to ensure his family's well-being and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy telephones and accessories for resale

loans.name: Fawzeihe

texts.en:
Fawzeihe is a 52-year-old married woman from Aqaba, Jordan.

Fawzeihe has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase more goods and make new decorations for her store.

Fawziehe is looking to expand her business and open a separate shop instead of working from home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and make new decorations

loans.name: Ri

texts.en:
Ri is 33 years old, married and has two children who are still in school.  She has been farming her rice field as her main source of income for twelve years and she supplements her income by planting cassava. She is the third cycled loan client who has successfully repaid her last loan with VisionFund.  After the loans, she earns more than twenty U.S. dollars per day and saves more than USD three per day.  

Given her good business and repayment, she is applying for another loan. She will use all of this loan to buy cassava from villages to sell. This loan will enable her to increase her business and earn more income to build on some savings and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 48 years old and married with six children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid for 19 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and flowers. 

Rebecca aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.ru: Акрамджон женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Акрамджон работает электриком в цехе электролиза на Алюминевом заводе. Он хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия, чтобы жить в удобстве. Акрамчон хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони, для штукатурки, обшивки потолка, покраски  окон и дверей. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Akramjon is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Akramjon works as an electrician at the electrolysis section of an aluminum factory. He wants to improve his housing conditions, in order to live in comfort. Akramjon would like to receive a loan in the amount of 5000 sonomi for plaster, ceiling panels and paint for windows and doors. He is thankful to you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is 50 years old and married with four children. Cerlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cerlita has borrowed and paid for 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal, bamboo and farming vegetables.

Cerlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 27-year-old divorced woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Alaa has a souvenir shop. She started her business years ago from her home. Then, with her hard work, she was able to expand it into a shop near her house.  

Alaa is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to purchase goods for the shop (souvenirs, accessories, etc.).

Alaa is looking to improve her shop by adding more space and employing other family members in it.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the shop (souvenirs, accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a food cafe business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase milk, coffee and snacks for her cafe business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, coffee and snacks for her cafe business.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскуль 58 лет, вдова. В 2007 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Рыскуль начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 40,000 сом (KGS), Рыскуль смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день две дойной коровы, две телки, одну лошадь, приносящее около 20,000 сом в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В будущем, Рыскуль планирует произвести ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Ryskul is 58 years old and a widow. In 2007, in search of an additional source of income for her family, Ryskul started up her business in cattle breeding. Using a starting sum of 40,000 som (KGS), Ryskul was able to start a farm, which now has two milking cows, two heifers, one horse. It yields around 20,000 som (KGS) a month from selling dairy products and meat. In order to further develop her business, Ryskul turned to the company "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle. In the future, Ryskul plans to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Turwanyubunebwe 22 B/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco  fait partie du groupe Turwanyubunebwe 22 B/Rsz. Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 2 à 16 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Bosco  est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco  voudrait agrandir la surface de culture. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of Turwanyubunebwe 22 B/Rsz Group. He's 42 years old and married with six children, age 2 to 16. Out of them, five attend school. His own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Jean Bosco is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, to be used to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected seeds. In the forthcoming years, Jean Bosco would like to expand his cultivation area. With his profits, he intends to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Aneesa

texts.en:
Aneesa is a 36-year-old woman from Madaba, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.

Aneesa is trading in clothes from her home. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes.

Aneesa is looking to improve her family's life conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 21-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to do maintenance for her home.
Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Manal's brother.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with 12 children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Mwanalima dreams of establishing another business of selling clothes and shoes in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase stock for her retail shop: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for retail shop: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Barooq

texts.en:
Barooq is a 56-year-old woman and a mother of two children.

Barooq is trading in home products. She is requesting a loan of 1,300 JOD to purchase more products for trading purposes.

Barooq is looking to open a shop to operate from instead of working from her home.

loans.use: to purchase more home products for trading purposes

loans.name: Umedullo

texts.ru: Умедулло женат и имеет троих детей. Он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания около 6 месяцев. Он вложил в свой бизнес все свои силы, чтобы  поставить себя на ноги. Его торговая точка находится в населенном пункте и уже имеет много клиентов. Умедулло хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы пополнить свой оборотный капитал. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umedullo is married and has three children. He has been in the grocery business for about six months. He has put all of his energy into his business in order to get himself established. His retail outlet is in a populated area, and he already has many customers. Umedullo would like to obtain a loan of 2000 som to buy grocery products to replenish his working capital. He looks forward to your assistance and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Ngosasia Shg Group

texts.en:
Isaac is the facilitator of the Ngosasia group. Isaac and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isaac takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Isaac had a good maize yield harvesting 6½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isaac was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isaac and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Isaac will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ngosasia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amez

texts.en:
Amez is a 35 year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 12 and 2 years.   Two of them are in school.  Amez has had a business of selling food in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Amez requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, to purchase sugar, oil and onions.  She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, onions for sale.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu, 52, is married and has four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Especially during the dry, hot season, the availability of vegetables for sale is lower compared to demand. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en: Nyamawi is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost his goat meat-selling business. With the loan, he wants to purchase more goats to boost his business. The previous loan improved his monthly income by 50 percent. He dreams of expanding his business to supply at wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell for meat

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 28-year-old married woman with no children. For the past two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan. 

Ayen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income she will generate from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en: Baasan is 54 years old and lives with her five children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. Four kids are employed, and one is a college student. She started her grocery retailing business in 1996 by opening a small shop. Her shop is well known in the neighborhood. Now that her kids are grown up, she wishes to expand her business by broadening her product range. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I never had an opportunity to expand my business.  Now that I have, I don't want to lose this opportunity." She is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gulzara

texts.ru: Гульзаре  24 года, вдова. Потеряв мужа в прошлом году во время трагических событий на юге страны, Гульзара одна воспитывает двух детей – двух и трех лет от роду. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в настоящее время Гульзара , при поддержке своего отца, начинает свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 30,000 сом (KGS), Гульзара смогла получить прибыль в этом месяце  в сумме 2,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока.  Также, Гульзара занимается выпечкой кондитерских изделий, таких как булочки, печенье у себя дома, что также служит небольшим доходом  в бюджет ее семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов и дойной коровы. В будущем, Гульзара планирует развить свое хозяйство, чтобы иметь возможность обучить своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulzara is 24, and a widow. After losing her husband during the tragic events in the southern part of the country last year, Gulzara has been raising two children — two and three years old, respectively — by herself. Seeking a way to provide for her family, Gulzara, with the support of her father, is starting her own business raising livestock. Utilizing a starting capital of 30,000 som (KGS), Gulzara has managed to earn a profit of 2,000 som (KGS) this month from selling milk. In addition, Gulzara is selling baked goods, such as pastries and cookies, that she makes at home. This also adds a little income to the family budget.
