Hoping to further grow her business, Gulzara has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and dairy cows. In the future, Gulzara plans to expand her business so that she is able to get her children an education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. For the past year, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akech requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and soda. She will use the extra income she generates as a result of this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soda for sale.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
A 43-year-old married mother of three dependent children, Sreang is a farmer in a rural area. She has been farming her rice field for 20 years, and supplements her income by raising pigs. With her current business, she earns around ten U.S. dollars per day. 

Having successfully repaid her first loan, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund.  She wants to buy 600 U.S. dollars-worth of piglets and feed for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to increase the number of pigs she has and also feed them so that they are healthy and fat. She also hopes to earn larger income, to make a better living, and build up some savings.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed for her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco  fait partie du groupe Dukore. Il a 35 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Bosco  est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour l’agriculture de riz.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco  voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz en achètent d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the Dukore group. He is 35 years old, married and has 4 children from 3 to 8 years old, of whom 1 goes to school. He completed 6 years of primary education.

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers for rice farming. 

His strategy to grow his business is to use select seed. In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to expand his surface area for rice farming by buying other fields. With the profits, he plans to educate his children and pay for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice farming.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Chizi has operated a grocery business, selling from door-to-door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Chizi plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan, 40 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife is a security guard and all of his children are students.

Jargalsaihan started his business in 2000 by making wooden furniture at home. He usually makes wooden boxes and chess sets, which are very beautiful and highly detailed. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Due to the money problem, I couldn't produce mass amount of products and because of that, I can't be a supplier." He is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Monica has operated a business selling clothes in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future. 

Monica plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Akuot

texts.en:
Akuot is a 38-year-old married woman with four children aged between 4 and 12, all of them in school. She has operated a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Akuot requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, 36, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a farmer and motor taxi driver. Ry is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a new motorbike to operate as a motor taxi. In the future, she would like to expand her business of growing rice and support her children to study at a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Morozova

texts.en:
Morozova is 58 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. 

Her husband is retired, her daughter helps with her business and her grandson is a school student. She started her grocery retail business in 1990 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is the only income in the family and is not quite enough to support them all.

Now that her children are grown up, she wishes to expand her business. She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy more goods. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "We're starting to have family crisis, I need to take action in order to protect our only income".

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anger

texts.en:
Anger is a 30-year-old married woman with two children between the ages of six and three.  Both of them are in school. For the past two years, she has had a business selling soft drinks in Bor, South Sudan.
 
Anger requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and fresh milk. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase soda and fresh milk to sell.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 31, lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school, in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, a wool-felting enterprise which he started earlier this year that produces handmade felt products such as slippers and boots.

Because his felting machine is old and very slow, in order to meet customer demand he is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy a new one.

loans.use: to buy a new felting machine.

loans.name: Hovakim

texts.en:
Hovakim is 22 years old and lives in Ljevan city with his wife. Not far from Ljevan city, in Kholatker village, Hovakim has a plot of land where he and his brother are busy with farming. 

On the farm Hovakim raises cows, pigs, ducks and geese.  He also has some bees and an orchard with different fruit-bearing trees. Hovakim sells his agricultural produce (which includes dairy products, meat, honey and fruits) to support his family. The family also consumes some of the produce.

Hovakim needs a loan of 600,000 AMD to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his only working sibling. He is hoping to earn money and enhance his standard of living. Even with all the difficulties that he has faced, Jaafar has been courageous and didn’t hesitate to open his own business. 

Jaafar started to work as a blacksmith in 2005 and has ten years of experience in this domain. He is a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today, he has asked for a loan of $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his smithy tools and buy additional ones, with the aim of attracting more customers. 

In the future, he plans to have a lovely family.

loans.use: to renew his smithy tools and buy additional ones.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 29-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is a mother of three children.

Rania is trading in clothes. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase clothes for this purpose.

Rania is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 39-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is a mother of eight children.

Asma is doing mosaics from her home. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase materials needed in making these mosaics.

Asma is looking to improve her project by purchasing equipment needed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in making mosaics

loans.name: Aluth

texts.en:
Aluth is a 29-year-old, married woman with five children. All five of them are in school. Aluth has had a business of selling tea in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Aluth has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and tea leaves. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru: Фаризе  33 года, замужем, воспитывает троих детей.  Муж работает  в пожарной службе. Учитывая небольшую заработную плату мужа, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2008 году  Фариза начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS), Фариза получает прибыль в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Фариза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В ближайших планах Фаризы -  купить бытовую технику домой и сделать ремонт.
texts.en: Fariza is 33 years old, married and is bringing up 3 children. Her husband is a fireman. Taking into account her husband's low wages and looking for a supplemental income source for her family, in 2008 Fariza started her own business in livestock husbandry.  After an initial investment of 15,000 KGS, Fariza earns 20,000 KGS per month in income from selling milk and dairy products. In order to further develop her business, Fariza came to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase additional livestock. In the near future Fariza is hoping to buy home appliances and fix up her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Nzazi

texts.en: Nzazi is requesting a Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to boost her vegetable selling business. With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the supply of vegetables during the hot and dry season, which is lower than demand. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nosaibah

texts.en:
Nosaibah is a 32-year-old married woman from Madaba, Amman in Jordan. She is a mother of three children.

Nosaibah is trading in clothes. She is requesting a loan of 1,300 JOD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Nosaibah is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokchea is 43 years old and married. She has four children who still live with the family and work at the rice field, in a garment factory and in construction. Sokchea has been farming as her main source of income for 22 years, supplementing her income by working as a construction worker. With her current business, she earns less than US $5 per day. 

Sokchea leads a group with two female members. Having repaid her first loan well, she is applying for another loan with her group member. Sokchea will use this loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this loan will help her to grow more rice to earn more income and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ishema Group

texts.fr:
Zachée  fait partie du groupe Ishema. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Zachée est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Zachée voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zachée is part of the Ishema group. He is 32 years old. He is married and has four children ranging from three to ten years old, two of whom are in school. He takes care of one other person beyond his children. He has a first-grade education.

Zachée grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers. 

His business growth strategy is to use specially selected seeds. In the coming years, Zachée would like to increase the size of his rice field. With the income, he will raise and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 33, is a married mother of three dependent children. Her oldest son is a construction worker and her other two are still in school. Rice farming has been Nat's main income source for 10 years, supplemented by transplanting rice seedlings for others. Her husband is a construction worker. Nat currently earns more than US $5 per day. 

This $600 loan is Nat’s first with VisionFund and she will use it to buy fertilizer and a water pump for her farm. She hopes to grow healthy rice and to increase her yield.  She also hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings; two of his siblings are still studying and one is working. They all depend on their father as their main source of income.  Despite his young age, Mohamad has operated his own rental car shop since 2008 and has the ambition to grow in his job. He is asking for a loan of $1,600 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to pay his university fees. He notes that this will help him graduate and pursue higher educational degrees. In the future, Mohamad plans to carry on his business properly.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun, 57 years old, is married and has five children, three of whom are dependent. One sells clothes on commission and two are still in school. Khun has been farming on her own land for 37 years, supplementing her income by growing cassava. She currently earns less than US $10 per day and saves around US $3 per day for the future. 

This is Khun’s second loan with VisionFund, having completely repaid her first one. She is applying for another loan as her business is doing well. She wants to use all of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, to rent a plot of farming land to extend the farm, and to pay for plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her farmland so as to grow more rice and earn a greater income to keep her children in school and to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to rent a plot of farming land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Hum's Group

texts.en:
Hum, 58, is a married mother of five children. Four are still in school while the oldest one sells groceries in the front yard. Hum is a farmer who has been farming for 30 years and supplements her income by planting cassava. Her husband is a village leader in a village located in the Prey Chhor district. She earns four U.S. dollars per day. 

As she did good business after her first loan, she is applying for a second one with her group member. She will use this loan to buy 300 U.S. dollars-worth of fertilizer and cassava seedlings. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and earn a larger income to have a better standard of living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nunik

texts.en:
Nunik was born in 1962 in Ljevan city. She is married and has three children and three grandchildren. 

Since 1995, she has made a living by buying and selling men and women’s clothing. Every week she goes to Yerevan to buy merchandise for her business and make sure she has a good assortment of items to sell to her customers. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to pay for the education of her children, her daughters’ weddings and the costs her son incurred when he entered the army. 

Thanks to her first Kiva loan Nunik increased the assortment of clothes in her shop. 

Nunik has collaborated with Nor Horizon for many years and now she is asking for a 600.000 AMD loan to buy winter clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to resell.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat is 40 years old, married and has three children who all are still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Kang Meas district. She has worked in farming for 18 years in order to make a living, and sometimes works for others to raise additional income. Her husband sells coconuts. With her current business, she earns more than 15 U.S. dollars per day. 

Savat is a second-cycle loan client who has a good repayment record. She is requesting another loan to buy a motorbike for her husband’s business. This loan will enable him to increase his coconut business so as to earn more income to better feed their children and also keep them in school

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband’s business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. In order to satisfy his family's needs, he decided to open his own business. He started to work as an blacksmith in 2009, having already had fifteen years of experience in this domain. 

He has gained a fair number of clients so far and is looking forward to attract more. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase metal for his business. This Kiva loan will certainly boost his productivity thus his profits. In the future, he plans to expand his business and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase metal for his business.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children all of whom go to school. Angela sells fruit and vegetables. She has been in this business for 10 years. She sells on retail basis from home. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of fruit and vegetables like mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, pineapples and passion fruits. Her major business challenges are  seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build. She lives in a rented house and  the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, pineapples and passion fruits.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year-old woman from Al Salt, Al Baqa; Jordan. She is a mother of five children.

Fatima has a home-based project in which she sells bird cages and food. She is requesting a loan of 900 JOD to purchase bird cages and food.

Fatima started her business by selling the birds to her friends as breeders. Then, she started selling them to the neighbors and people in the nearby area.

Fatima is looking to open a shop for her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues fatima did not wish to appear in a photo publishe on the internet, and Fatima's husband appeared in the photo in her place

loans.use: to purchase bird cages and food

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 52-year-old mother of seven children, five of whom are dependent and still in school. They help her with the farm during their spare time. She has been farming her rice field for 30 years, supplementing her income by raising pigs. Her husband works as a construction worker. With her current business, she earns about 5 U.S. dollars per day to feed her big family.

This is Sophal's first loan with VisionFund. She will use part of this loan to buy a plot of farming land to extend her farm and part of the loan to buy feed for her pigs. This loan will enable her to produce more rice and feed her pigs so they will become healthy and fat. She also hopes that she will be able to make a bigger income so she can feed her family better, especially her children, and also keep them in school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farming land and feed for her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha is a 28-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Muntaha is selling clothes from her home. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Muntaha is looking to improve her family's living income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Bokk Diom 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Bokk Diom regroupe quatre femmes et un homme qui s’activent dans la vente de paniers, fruits, bancs.
La présidente, une dame de 40 ans  est veuve et mère de famille. Elle vend  des balaies, des oranges, des paniers. Le prêt lui servira  à renforcer son activité.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité Ndew arrive à gérer sa famille au quotidien.
texts.en:
Bokk Diom Group is made up of four women and one man who sell baskets, fruits, and benches. 

The group's president is a 40-year-old woman, who is a widow and the mother of a family. She sells brooms, oranges, and baskets. She will use her loan to bolster her business.

With her profit, Ndew manages to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and crafts (baskets, benches, …)

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 42 years old, widowed with two dependent children who are still in school. They assist her on the farm during their spare time. She has been farming her rice field as a primary source of income for about 25 years in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district. She supplements her income by raising pigs. She manages to earn less than 5 U.S. dollars per day.

With her current business, she is requesting her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy more piglets for her pig raising business. She hopes to generate more income from this business and make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her pig-raising business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dukoreneza Group

texts.fr:
Pierre  fait partie du groupe Dukoreneza. Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 2 à 11 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Pierre est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture. Dans les prochaines années, Pierre voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Pierre belongs to the Dukoreneza group. He is 30 years old and married, with four children ranging from 2 to 11 years age, two of whom are in school. He has one other dependent in addition to his children. His level of education is six grades of primary school.

Pierre grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers. His strategy for growing his business is to expand his cultivated land. In the years to come, Pierre would like to become a major rice producer in his region. He plans to use his profits to educate his children and pay for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Sop Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Fama est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 23 Novembre 2011 ou elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Dabakh.

Fama est la responsable du groupe elle debout à gauche de la photo habillée en vert.

Elle fait du commerce de détails dans la vente de denrées alimentaires tels du riz, du sucre, de l'huile etc.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 50000 francs CFA elle va acheter du riz de l huile et du sucre à des tarifs forfaitaire.

A l aide de ses bénéfices Fama va va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Fama, age 42, is married and the mother of two children. She's been a member of the Banc Villageois since November 23, 2011. She's a member of solidarity group Sope Dabakh. Fama, standing on the right and wearing green in the photograph, is also responsible for the group. She retails food staples, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. With her new loan of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 92), she will buy rice, oil, and sugar at a fixed price. Thanks to her profits, Fama will help her husband in taking care of their children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and sugar to resell

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth, 31 years old, has 2 children, one in school and one too young to attend school. She has been farming for 15 years on a rice field and 10 years on a cassava plantation. She also raises pigs to generate additional income. She earns about US $4 per day from her current businesses and saves only $2 per day after offsetting daily expenses.

This is Soth's first loan with VisionFund, and she will use it to buy more piglets for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income to support her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en: Izolda operates a greenhouse. She is requesting a loan to help her purchase a new heating system which would make the greenhouse  more effective. Izolda could then grow and sell more fruits and vegetables and increase her business income. With this additional income, Izolda will ensure a stable future for her family. Izolda lives with her husband, son and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for a heating system for the greenhouse

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She lives in a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Jumwa has operated a grocery business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a retail shop business which provides her with another source of income. Jumwa faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

Jumwa plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Simi

texts.en:
Simi, 29, is a married mother of 2 children who are still in school. The primary sources of her income are rice farming and cassava planting. She supplements her income by plowing others' farms. She currently earns about US $7 per day to feed her family.

This is Simi's first loan with VisionFund. She wants to use the US $125 loan to buy cassava seedlings for her plantation to increase her business. This loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her life and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who attend school. Catherine lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

Catherine has operated a retail business for the past 5 years, selling yellow bananas at the market. She works six days a week, and also sells water as another source of income. Catherine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas and vegetables. Her major business challenges are seasonality and traveling to villages for the bananas. Her goals and hopes are to become a wholesaler, to buy a plot of land and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en: Vardanush works as a teacher at the local school and as a governess at the local kindergarden. To insure better living standards for her family, Vardanush is also engaged in agriculture. She lives with her husband, who helps her run the farm. She has applied for a loan to increase the number of cattle. Vardanush will develop her farm and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for cattle

loans.name: Angeth

texts.en: Angeth is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. She has operated a business selling sugar in Bor, South Sudan for two years. Angeth has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng is a 24-year-old mother of 2 dependent children. She has been working on her rice paddy field and cassava plantation for 7 years in a village in the Ponhea Krek district. Sometimes she works for others to raise additional income. She currently earns only about US $3 per day from her business.

Sokheng is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She will use it to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her plantation. She hopes this loan enables her to produce more crop yield and increase her income to feed her family better.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widowed mother of five children, three of whom still attend school. She lives in a family house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, Umazi has operated a food stall and dry fish sales business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Umazi dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand.

Umazi plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase fish for resale and bundles of wheat flour for making dumplings. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale and bundles of wheat flour for making dumplings

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past year, Sakina has operated a tailoring business from home. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is lack of enough customers. Sakina dreams of accessing loan facilities to boost her business.

Sakina plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase another sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Sam Orn

texts.en:
Som Orn, 47, is married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. Her main source of family income is from rice and cassava farming; she also supplements her income by raising pigs and catching fish to sell. She now earns less than 5 U.S. dollars a day to feed her family.

Som is requesting her first loan from VisionFund. She will use this 250 U.S.-dollar loan to buy cassava seedlings to enlarge her cassava plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more cassava so as to earn additional income to create a better life. She also hopes to set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings to enlarge her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has a small shop from which she sells food. She has been engaged in this business for three years, during which favorable conditions have allowed her to expand it.

This loan of 2000 USD will allow Anahit to increase sales and develop her business. She hopes to earn more income and insure a sustainable future for her son.

loans.use: to purchase food for her shop.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is widowed and has eight children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has struggled to make a living by working in her rice field for thirty years to feed her children. For the past ten years she has supplemented her earnings by planting cassava. She currently earns less than 5 U.S. dollars a day and saves around two U.S. dollars a day after expenses.

This is Kean's first loan with VisionFund. She will use all of this 250 USD to buy cassava seedlings for her cassava plantation. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings for her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jasho Group

texts.en:
Isaack is the facilitator of the Jasho group, Isaack and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isaack takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Isaack had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isaack was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isaack and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Isaack will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jasho group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Isaack is pictured with his group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aleay

texts.en:
Aleay is a 30-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of four and fifteen years old. All of them are in school.

Aleay has been selling food in the south of Sudan for two years. She has requested this loan of 800 SDG through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cabbages and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with eight children; five attend school, two have graduated, and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a vegetable stall, and she also sells dried fish. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge she faces is price fluctuations. Mwaka dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is single, has one child, and operates a grocery shop, which she started three years ago. Jane also owns a boutique. 

Jane is applying for a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase new stocks of potatoes, onions, and oranges and to rebuild the kiosk. Her main challenge is that most of her produce is highly perishable; she must therefore rely upon good and committed clients. Jane would like to purchase a freezer to increase the shelf life of her produce but lacks the necessary funds. She will use the additional income to pay her utility bills, get good housing, and educate her child. She looks forward to establishing a larger store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and rebuild her kiosk.

loans.name: Sope Serign Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont pratiquement de la même localité. 

Yacine (à gauche de la photo habillé en bleu) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 62 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant .

Yacine fait du commerce de détail avec la vente de produits halieutiques.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 50000 elle va acheter des paniers de poissons fumés et de poissons séchés destinés à la revente au niveau du marché de son quartier.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle va acheter du riz de l huile et du sucre pour son enfant et lui payer des ordonnances en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Sope Serign Saliou Group was established on November 23, 2001. He's made up of eight women, who are practically from the same town.

Yacine (on the left in the photograph, wearing blue) is responsible for the group. She's 62 years old and the mother of one child. She retails fish products.

With her new loan of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 92) she will buy baskets of smoked fish and dried fish, and resell them at the market in her neighborhood.

With her profits, she will buy rice, oil, and sugar for her child, and pay prescription costs in case of sickness.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and dried fish to resell

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркуль 45 лет, замужем, имеет шестерых детей. Муж работает таксистом. В связи с тем, что расходы большой семьи Атыркуль не удавалось покрыть за счет заработной платы мужа,  в 2003 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, Атыркуль начала заниматься торговлей женскими халатами, пижамой и носками на местном рынке. Стартовав с суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS), она арендовала торговое место и успешно торгует вместе со своими дочерями. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыркуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров за счет закупа одежды зимнего периода.   Доходы от кредита Атыркуль планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Atyrkul is 45 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Because she couldn't cover all the expenses of her large family on her husband's earnings, and in search of a source of supplemental income, in 2003 Atyrkul began to sell women's robes, pajamas, and socks at the local market.  Starting with 20,000 som (KGS), she rented a stall and is now selling successfully with her daughters. 

To further develop her business, Atyrkul turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to broaden her assortment of goods by buying up a stock of winter clothes.  Atyrkul plans to allocate the income from her loan to the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Sope Serign Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent la même localité. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité

Amy (debout à gauche de la photo de tout blanc vêtue)est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Amy fait de l embauche ovine avec son prêt de 50000 francs CFA elle va acheter 40 poussins et 3 sacs d aliments afin de développer son activité de petit élevage de volaille.

Elle compte revendre ses poussins plus tard pour faire des bénéfices qu'elle va utiliser pour régler les frais médicaux et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 23 rd November 2011.It is made up of 9 women who live in the same neighbourhood. They are organised by proximity and by affinity.

Amy (standing up on the left of the photo dressed in white ) is the leader of the group. She is 38 years old. She is married with 5 children.

Amy fattens sheep and with her loan of 50000 CFA francs she wants to purchase 40 chickens and 3 bags of foodstuffs in order to develop her small poultry farming business.

She intends to resell her chickens later to make a profit which she will use to pay medical expenses and school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase chickens that she will fatten and resell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married lady who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She runs a junior school, which has been in operation for three years and has a total of eight employees. Caroline is applying for a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase desks, textbooks, and stationery.

Her future ambitions include increasing the number of streams (groupings of students based on ability and/or curricula) within the school and modernizing its operations, including the purchase of computers. The main challenge she faces is fee payments; at times, accounts are in arrears, slowing down their plans. Caroline will use the extra income from this loan to improve the services the school provides and in turn increase enrollment.

loans.use: to purchase desks, textbooks, and stationery.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 4 and 16. All of them are in school. Achol has been selling food in a hotel in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achol has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice, and maize flour. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize flour, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and owns a cosmetics shop. She began the business in 2002, using her retirement benefits. She learned about Milango from her friends and joined in order to access more funding for her business.

Khadija is applying for a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase more cosmetics. The main challenge the business faces is inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of many customers. Her future plans include opening up a wholesale cosmetics business. She would also like to start another business using the income obtained from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Twisungane/kng Group

texts.fr:
Augustin  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Kng. Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 9 à 13 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Augustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Augustin voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Augustin is part of the Twisungane/Kng group. He is 45 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 13, all 3 of whom are in school. His level of education is 6 years of primary school.

Augustin is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers. 

His strategy for growing his business is to grow rice on bigger pieces of land. In the future, he would like to become the rice supplier for his region. With his profits, Augustin plans to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Silakwe Shg Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Silakwe SHG group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting 6½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Silakwe SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau is a 29-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 3 and 15. She has been running a shop in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Adau is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cooking oil and biscuits to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Kabuluru Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is the facilitator of the Kabulolo group. Everlyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a good maize yield harvesting 5½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and pay back her loans.

In 2012, the members of Kabulolo group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Everlyne is pictured with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Virab

texts.en:
Virab is a farmer who raises cattle and keeps a greenhouse. He lives with his wife, two children, and parents. The family's daily costs have increased over the past few years, so Virab needs additional income to make ends meet. 

Virab plans to develop his farm. He has requested a loan to purchase a cow, forage, and seeds to cultivate his land. Virab will use any additional profits to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, forage, and seeds.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a coconut supplier in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has four children. Six years ago, Nathaniel sold one of his cattle to raise the capital required to start the business, but it was not sufficient to run the business. 

Since being introduced to Milango, he has decided to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more coconuts to sell. December is a busy month, and he foresees a good business opportunity. The coastal people grate the coconut and add it into many meals during this period. 

Nathaniel looks forward to supplying other regions within Kenya. He intends to use the extra income obtained from this loan to pay school fees for his child who is in the seventh grade.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has sold charcoal in the south of Sudan for the past four years.

Adut has requested this loan of 800 SDG through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to work toward building a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Women's Hope Group

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old, single, and has one child who is 21 years old. She has two dependents, who are her sister's daughters. 

Susan operates a clothing shop at the local business center. She has a grocery stall in the nearby flea market. She has been in business for six years. She has no other source of income. Her business is affected by fluctuating demand. 

In the future, Susan wants to open a grocery shop in Masvingo's town center. The loan will help her to look after her sister's children.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tumaini Group in Western Kenya! Fridah is the facilitator of the Tumaini group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fridah takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Fridah had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Fridah was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fridah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income her from maize sales, Fridah will educate her children, save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Urumuri/bgrm Group

texts.fr:
Seleman fait partie du groupe Urumuri/bgrm. Il a 51 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 4 à 21 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Seleman est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture. Dans les prochaines années, Seleman voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Seleman is a member of the Urumuri/bgrm group. He is 51 years old and is married with six children ages 4 to 21, of whom four attend school. His own level of education has been six years of primary school.

Seleman is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to increase the area he cultivates. In coming years, Seleman would like to become the supplier of rice for the region. With the profits, he plans to take care of his children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nekuye B W G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nekuye B W Group in Western Kenya! Judith is the facilitator of the Nekuye B W group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Judith takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Judith will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nekuye B W group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Judith with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en:
Maisa is a 36-year-old married housewife and a mother of five boys and girls.

In preparation for their kids' future, Maisa decided to help her husband who is a painter, by starting a small retail business a year ago selling clothes. Recently she has added blankets to the products she sells.

Now Maisa wants to buy more blankets and winter clothes, so she has applied for a loan in order to do that.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries and clothes  for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products to sell at flea markets and hair salons

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans owns a carpentry shop in Mombasa, Kenya. He is single and has operated the business for eight years. He started the business from the savings he made from casual jobs.

Evans is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to buy a drilling machine and other carpentry tools. 

He looks forward to owning a construction firm in the future. The challenges he faces include finding customers (especially in the low season) and some do not pay on time. 

He learned about Milango Financial Services from a Milango employee.

loans.use: to buy a drilling machine and other carpentry tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and material.

loans.name: Mulimani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulimani Group in Western Kenya! Phoebe is the facilitator of the Mulimani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Phoebe takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phoebe had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phoebe was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phoebe and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Phoebe will educate her children, save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mulimani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lotions, fish, curtains, and satellite dishes

loans.name: Kuwirirana Group

texts.en:
Magrety is 47 years old, widowed, and has 9 children aged 30, 29, 27, 21, 18, 15, 13, 8 and 6. Only 4 attend school, and she has two brothers who are also her dependents. 

She rears chickens and sells clothes and blankets. The family helps out in the business. She buys her products from nearby towns and from South Africa. She operates her business at her home in the Mucheke district of Masvingo.  She has been in business for 5 years and has no employees.  She receives her husband's pension as another source of income.


Magrety faces the challenge of debtors who fail to pay and chicks that die prematurely due to heat. She would like to own a poultry shop in town and a boutique. She will use the money to buy chicks, stockfeeds, blankets, and clothes.  This loan will help her take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks, stockfeeds, blankets, and clothes

loans.name: Wekhaka A Group

texts.en:
Prisila is the facilitator of the Wekhaka A group. Prisila and her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Prisila joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Prisila had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Prisila was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Prisila and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Prisila will invest in educating her children and saving for the future. In 2012, the members of Wekhaka A group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
The photograph shows Prisila with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Korandebe/gtng Group

texts.fr:
Ramadhan fait partie du groupe Korandebe/Gtng. Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant de 13 ans, dont il est scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Ramadhan est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture. Dans les prochaines années, Ramadhan voudrait être le premier fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ramadhan is a member of the Korandebe/Gtng group. He is 42 years old, married, and has 1 child who is 13 years old and attends school. He has 5 years of primary school education.

Ramadhan is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand the surface area of his cultivation. Over the next couple of years, Ramadhan would like to become the largest supplier of rice in his region. With the profits, he plans to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Bokk Diom 28 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Bokk Diom  28 dont la présidente est la dame Adama, regroupe 5 membres  dont la principale des activités qu’elles exercent est la vente de fruits à hauteur d’un arrêt de bus. En dehors de cela, il y a l’embouche.
Adama, la présidente pratique les deux activités, mais elle est beaucoup plus connu pour la vente de fruits : orange, melon, mandarine et c’est à cela que va lui servir le prêt. Elle a une expérience de  dix ans.
Elle  n’a pas de charge et aimerai avec son bénéfice  améliorer son activité d’embouche.
texts.en:
The group Bokk Diom 28, the president of which is the lady Adama, is made up of five members. The principal commercial activity that they practice is fruit sales in the vicinity of a bus stop. Besides that, there is animal fattening.
Adama, the president, practices the two activities, but she is much more well known for fruit sales: orange, melon, mandarin, and this is what the loan will be used for. She has ten years of experience.
She is not providing for anyone, and would like to use her earnings to improve her animal fattening business.

loans.use:
aheter des fruits:mandarine,melon...et faire aussi de l 'embouche
to buy fruit: mandarin, melon, and also to practice animal fattening

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is 27 years old. She has three children to raise with her husband who works in one of the governmental entities in Jordan as an engineer.

Living in Al Balqaa where there are a lot of fruit farms has given her the opportunity to work collecting this fruit such as oranges, apples, olives, etc. for the owners, based on the seasons. But because there are sometimes low seasons, Ibtisam also faces decreases in their income, too, so she started a small business at home selling home products such as cups, glasses, and so on besides working in the farms. 

It has been two years since she started, and now she is applying for a loan to add more home products to what she is selling.

loans.use: to add more home products to what she is selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flea market products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy Chicks and Feeds, fabric and Clothes for resale

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition she has a boda boda (motorcycle) business, which contributes another source of income. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cereals and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en: Achol is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan, for three years. Achol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase salt, onions, and soda. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase salt, onions, and soda for sale.

loans.name: Vision Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vision SHG Group in Western Kenya! Fatuma is the facilitator of the Vision SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fatuma takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Fatuma had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Fatuma was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fatuma  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Fatuma will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Vision SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Canaan W G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Canaan W Group in Western Kenya! Janerose is the facilitator of the Canaan W group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janerose takes care of  three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janerose had a very good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janerose was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janerose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Janerose will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Canaan W group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Janerose with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gracious Group

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Scholastica from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with three children; one is attending school. She also cares for one dependent. 

Scholastica runs a manufacturing business producing peanut butter. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is that labor is in short supply due to a lack of funds. 

Scholastica has requested a loan of $400 to buy groundnuts. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the  welfare of her family. In the future, Scholastica plans to supply bigger grocery chain stores.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for peanut-butter making.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
This is Helen, who is 52 years old and from Machipisa, Zimbabwe. A widow with five children, she also cares for her aging mother. 

Helen runs a manufacturing business, making freezits (frozen soft drinks) and also selling kitchen ware. The business has been in operation for two years. Helen says the main challenges she faces are lack of capital and power disruptions, as well as storage of her wares. 

Helen has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy raw materials for making freezits. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Helen plans to have industrial machinery and own a freezit wholesale company.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make freezits (frozen soft drinks).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay import duty and buy some clothes for resale

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years Medza has operated a clothes shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Inadequate capital to expand her business is her major challenge.

Medza decided to join Yehu to access their loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of khangas (a long wrap) and kikois (much like a sarong) for resale. Medza dreams of establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of khangas and kikois for resale.

loans.name: Chieer

texts.en:
Chieer is a 38-year-old married woman with one child. She has had a business for three year selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.
Chieer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Batanai Group

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Danai from Harare. She is divorced with three children, all attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Danai runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are customs duties and competition. 

Danai has requested a loan of $400 to add a stock of fashionable clothes to cater to different age groups. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family as well as pay school fees on time for her children. In the future, Danai plans to have a variety of goods ranging from school uniforms to casual wear.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Kubudirira Group

texts.en: This is 56 year old Concelia from Machipisa in Harare. She is married with six children, three attending school. She also cares for six grandchildren. Concelia runs an agriculture business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 18 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of capital to buy chicks and feeds. Concelia has requested a loan of $400 to buy more chicks and feeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Concelia plans to be able to keep at least 200 birds per calendar month .

loans.use: to buy chicks and feeds

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children; four attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other coconut retailers in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the market.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale and establish a vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale and establish a vegetable stall

loans.name: Weuya W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weuya W Group in Western Kenya! Selina is the facilitator of the Weuya W group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Selina takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds at a cheap price and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Selina had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Selina was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Selina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Selina will educate her children and repay her loans.

In 2012, the members of Weuya W group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Selina with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.
